fundanius: <entryFree id="n19036" type="main" key="Funda_ni^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fundānĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n19036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n19036.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Fundanius, <hi rend="ital">Varro's father-in-law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19036.2" n="II" level="1"> C. Fundanius, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and who was defended by him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 5:19" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 5, 19</bibl>; v. the few fragments of the oration in Orell. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> IV. 2, p. 445</bibl>; this oration is called Fundaniana in <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 2, 342</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19036.3" n="III" level="1"> Fundanius, <hi rend="ital">a comedian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Horace and Maecenas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 19</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fundānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Varro's wife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19037" type="main" key="Funda_ni^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fundānĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fundā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Fundi.</entryFree>
fundatio: <entryFree id="n19038" type="main" key="funda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. fundo</etym>, <sense id="n19038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a founding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foundation</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fundationes aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">substructionis fodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>; Hil. Trin. 11, 37.</sense></entryFree>
fundator: <entryFree id="n19039" type="main" key="funda_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a founder</hi> (very rare for conditor, creator): <cit><quote lang="la">Praenestinae urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2</bibl></cit>. 1, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii Romani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 56, 5 sq.</bibl></cit> <cb n="FUND" /> —</sense><sense id="n19039.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">securitatis publicae (Licinius),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1071</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietis (Constantinus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1075</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fundatus: <entryFree id="n19040" type="main" key="funda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 2. fundo.</entryFree>
fundi: <entryFree id="n19041" type="main" key="Fundi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fundi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-coast town of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Appian Way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Formiae and Tarracina</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Fondi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19041.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19041.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fundānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Fundi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <trans><tr>near Fundi</tr>, <tr>whence the famous Caecuban wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 59</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, Amyclae, situated on the Lacus Fundanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:115" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 65</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fundāni</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Fundi</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 821</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19041.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fundānĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules,</quote> <trans><tr>who was worshipped at Fundi</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Flor. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1539</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fundibalum: <entryFree id="n19042" type="main" key="fundi^ba^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundĭbălum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-bŭlum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">fun-dĭbălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vox hibr. from funda and <foreign lang="greek">ba/llw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n19042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hurling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slinging machine</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 6, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 37, 40</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 10, 2</bibl>: Fundibali <foreign lang="greek">liqobo/loi</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
fundibularius: <entryFree id="n19043" type="main" key="fundi^bu^la_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundĭbŭlārius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slinger</hi> (for the class. funditor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 3, 25</bibl>; Judith, 6, 8: <foreign lang="greek">sfendoni^tai</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
fundibulum: <entryFree id="n19044" type="gloss" key="fundi^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundĭbŭlum</orth> <foreign lang="greek">xw/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n19044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a funnel</hi>, Gloss. Philox. [1. fundo].</sense></entryFree>
fundito: <entryFree id="n19045" type="main" key="fundi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>1. fundo</etym> (anteand post-class.). <sense id="n19045.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hurl</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sling at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">globos volantes jussi funditarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19045.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantilla tanta verba funditat,</quote> <trans><tr>pours forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne illa ecastor faenerato funditat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
funditor: <entryFree id="n19046" type="main" key="fundi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>funda</etym>, <sense id="n19046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who fights with a sling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a slinger</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">sfendoni/ths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a sort of light-armed soldier</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculator, sagittarius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 4</bibl>; 2, 24, 4 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:49:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes">49, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
funditus: <entryFree id="n19047" type="main" key="fundi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>fundus</etym>, <sense id="n19047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from the very bottom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from the foundation</hi> (syn.: a fundamento, ab radicibus, radicitus, penitus; freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n19047.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentum P. Scipionis funditus delevit ac sustulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:36:section=79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 36, § 79</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginem et Numantiam funditus sustulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 11, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:12:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">destructum templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evellere,</quote> <trans><tr>by the roots</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19047.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">utterly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entirely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">totally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli magnos commovit funditus aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae domus tam stabilis, quae tam firma civitas est, quae non odiis et discidiis funditus possit everti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta, quae probas, funditus evertunt amicitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:25:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 25, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitias funditus tollere e vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 42, 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 41, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollere veritatem et fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:62:209" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 62, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 18, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 33, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abolitae leges et versae funditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdidisti me sodalem funditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 154</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaemonios funditus vicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:33:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 33, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 413</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=333" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 333</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 132 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne res redeant ad nilum funditus omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 673</bibl></cit>: curare nomen, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 239</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 163 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">perspicere omnes res gestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum rerum funditus esse expertem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne spondeus quidem funditus est repudiandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:64:216" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 64, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funditus aliquid pessum dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19047.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">at the bottom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">below</hi> (only ante- and post-class., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">subsedit funditus, ut faex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 497</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
fundo: <entryFree id="n19048" type="main" key="fundo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundo</orth>, <itype>fūdi, fūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root FUD; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*x*u, xev</foreign>-, in <foreign lang="greek">xe/w, xeu/sw</foreign>; <cit><quote lang="la">Lat. futis, futtilis, ec-futio, re-futo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 204 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 204 sq.</bibl></cit></etym>, <sense id="n19048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pour out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19048.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of fluids. </sense><sense id="n19048.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(natura terram) sucum venis cogebat fundere apertis Consimilem lactis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:812" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 812</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem e patera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum liquorem (i. e. vinum) de patera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina paterā in aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 160</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum inter cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:594" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 594</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum super aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:247" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo rite mero libans carchesia Baccho Fundit humi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laticem urnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 348</bibl></cit>: cf. Ov. M. <pb n="793" /> <cb n="FUND" /> 5, 540: <cit><quote lang="la">fundit Anigros aquas,</quote> <trans><tr>pours out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parumne fusum est Latini sanguinis?</quote> <trans><tr>shed</tr>, <tr>spilt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine ob rem publicam fuso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fr. 2:96:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fr. 2, 96, 2</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem de regno (i. e. propter regnum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">memorandum, in septem lacus eum (Strymonem) fundi,</quote> <trans><tr>discharges itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentibus procellis fusus imber,</quote> <trans><tr>pouring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 32, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis in corporibus fusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:77:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 77, 310</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19048.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n19048.4" n="a" level="4"> Of metals, <hi rend="ital">to make by melting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to melt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">found</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exolevit fundendi aeris pretiosi ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caldarium (aes) funditur tantum, malleis fragile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 20, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aere fuso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 11, 24, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 14, 42, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glandes, Auct. B. Afr. 20, 3: Theodorus ipse se ex aere fudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne statuam quidem inchoari, cum ejus membra fundentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fusis omnibus membris (statuae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7 praef" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">2: olim quaerere amabam, Quid sculptum infabre, quid fusum durius esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n19048.5" n="b" level="4"> In medic. lang.: aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to cause one to have fluid stools</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to relax the bowels</hi> (opp. comprimere): si compresserit aliquem morbus aut fuderit, Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; cf. under <pos>P. a.</pos>—</sense><sense id="n19048.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19048.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bathe</hi> with a liquid (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">(ossa) niveo fundere lacte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo tempora funde mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19048.8" n="2" level="3"> Of things non-fluid. </sense><sense id="n19048.9" n="a" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to pour forth in abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to scatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurl; to spread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diffuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">desectam cum stramento segetem corbibus fudere in Tiberim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picem reliquasque res, quibus ignis excitari potest, fundebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:243" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:647" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(solis) radios per opaca domorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (maculas) incuria fudit,</quote> <trans><tr>has scattered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundunt se carcere laeti Thraces equi,</quote> <trans><tr>pour themselves forth</tr>, <tr>rush out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:611" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se cuncta manus ratibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:662" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 662</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">littera fundens se in charta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 25, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna se fundebat per fenestras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 152</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne (vitis) in omnes partes nimia fundatur,</quote> <trans><tr>spread out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines fusi per agros ac dispersi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 42, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19048.10" n="b" level="4"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n19048.11" n="(a)" level="5"> With the accessory notion of production, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produce</hi> (in abundance): <cit><quote lang="la">crescunt arbusta et fetus in tempore fundunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 351</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terra feta frugibus et vario leguminum genere, quae cum maxima largitate fundit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:62:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 62, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores aut fruges aut bacas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus materiae (vites),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum centesimo Leontini campi fundunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 10, 21, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile illa (piscium ova) aqua et sustinentur et fetum fundunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(terra) animal prope certo tempore fudit Omne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 823</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:917" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 917</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fudit equum magno tellus percussa tridenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africa asinorum silvestrium multitudinem fundit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 30, 46, § 108</bibl></cit>: quae te beluam ex utero, non hominem fudit, Cic. Pis. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 139</bibl>, v. Forbig. ad h. l.—</sense><sense id="n19048.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With the secondary notion of depth or downward direction, <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast to the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prostrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(victi hostes) et de jugis, quae ceperant, funduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 43, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec prius absistit, quam septem ingentia victor Corpora (cervorum) fundat humi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 193</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:533" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 533</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem arcu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:446" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 446</bibl></cit>.—In middle force: <cit><quote lang="la">fundi in alga,</quote> <trans><tr>to lie down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:252" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 252</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq. milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanquish</hi> an enemy: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes nefarios prostravit, fudit, occidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 10, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus caesus fususque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos caedere, fundere atque fugare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 58, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaetulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 88:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 88, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classes fusae fugataeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 79:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 79, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si vi fudisset cecidissetque hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes de jugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 43, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallos de delubris vestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas omnes copias a se uno proelio fusas ac superatas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Massilienses crebris eruptionibus fusi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latini ad Veserim fusi et fugati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatuor exercitus Carthaginiensium fudi, fugavi, Hispania expuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 28, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. Drak. on 38, 53, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">less freq. in a reversed order: alios arma sumentes fugant funduntque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:46" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: omnibus hostium copiis fusis armisque<cb n="FUND" />  exutis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnas copias hostium fudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinos equitatu fudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Armeniorum copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximas copias parva manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n19048.13" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19048.14" n="A" level="2"> Ingen., <hi rend="ital">to pour out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imago de corpore fusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam moribundo corpore fudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1033" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1033</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 700</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concidit ac multo vitam cum sanguine fudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 532</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circuli (appellantur), quod mixta farina et caseo et aqua circuitum aequabiliter fundebant,</quote> <trans><tr>poured out</tr>, <tr>spread out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=106" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem secutus Cicero hanc famam latius fudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vero causa ea inciderit, in qua vis eloquentiae possit expromi: tum se latius fundet orator,</quote> <trans><tr>will display himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 36, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitio, fusa per gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 72 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque se tanta in eo (Cicerone) fudisset ubertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundet opes, Latiumque beabit divite lingua,</quote> <trans><tr>riches of expression</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 121</bibl></cit>. —Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam negant, nec virtutes nec vitia crescere: tamen utrumque eorum fundi quodammodo et quasi dilatari putant,</quote> <trans><tr>to be diffused</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:15:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 15, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">modo virtus latius funditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74, 27</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">semper ex eo, quod maximas partes continet latissimeque funditur, tota res appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:5:30:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 30, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe in amplificanda re funditur numerose et volubiliter oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Or. 62:210" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 62, 210</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19048.15" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">to pour forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quam (arteriam) vox principium a mente ducens percipitur et funditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 149</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">e quibus elici vocem et fundi videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inanes sonos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 26, 73</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">inani voce sonare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:15:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 15, 48</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">sonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba poëtarum more (opp. ratione et arte distinguere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus hexametros aliosque variis modis atque numeris ex tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 194</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">grave plenumque carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam bonos septenarios ad tibiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">physicorum oracula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has ore loquelas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:842" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 842</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces pectore ab imo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 55</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 234</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:53" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mera mendacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tu verba fundis hic, sapientia?</quote> <trans><tr>you waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opprobria rustica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iras inanes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:697" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehemens et liquidus puroque simillimus amni Fundet opes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 25:10 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 25, 10 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diffuse.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19048.16" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aër) tum fusus et extenuatus sublime fertur, tum autem concretus in nubes cogitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>: fusior alvus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">more relaxed</hi> (opp. astrictior), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga (opp. restricta),</quote> <trans><tr>wide</tr>, <tr>full</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallorum fusa et candida corpora,</quote> <trans><tr>full</tr>, <tr>plump</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 21, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi in omnem partem,</quote> <trans><tr>extended</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 440</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non fusior ulli Terra fuit domino,</quote> <trans><tr>a broader</tr>, <tr>larger kingdom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 670</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19048.17" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">copious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diffuse; flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus sermonis non liquidum, non fusum ac profluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 159</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">constricta an latius fusa narratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia abundantior atque ultra quam oporteat fusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illud, quod ad omnem honestatem pertinet, decorum, quam late fusum sit, appareat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28, 98</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vox) in egressionibus fusa et securae claritatis (opp. contracta),</quote> <trans><tr>unrestrained</tr>, <tr>free</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periodus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fusiores liberioresque numeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua Graeca prolixior fusiorque quam nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locis ac descriptionibus fusi ac fluentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:138" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenior Aeschines et magis fusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis et candidus et fusus Herodotus (opp. densus et brevis et semper instans sibi Thucydides),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 73</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> seems not to occur.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fūse</orth>. * </sense><sense id="n19048.18" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to A.) <hi rend="ital">Spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(manus) fusius paulo in diversum resolvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:97" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19048.19" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to B.) <hi rend="ital">Copiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at length</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diffusely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae fuse olim disputabantur ac libere, ea nunc articulatim distincteque dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa dicere fuse lateque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:26:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 26, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuse lateque dicendi facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 32, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuse et copiose augere et ornate aliquid (opp. brevia et acuta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 7</bibl></cit>, <cb n="FUND" /> 26.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum uberius disputantur et fusius (opp. brevius angustiusque concluduntur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fusius et ornatius rem exponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:128" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 128</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> seems not to occur.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19049" type="main" key="fundo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fundus</etym>, <sense id="n19049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay the bottom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foundation</hi> of a thing, <hi rend="ital">to found</hi> (syn.: condo, exstruo, etc.). </sense><sense id="n19049.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (perh. only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">haec carina satis probe fundata et bene statuta est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is laid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 44</bibl></cit> (v. Ritschl ad h. l.); <cit><quote lang="la">dum mea puppis erat validā fundata carinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Erycino in vertice sedes fundatur Veneri Idaliae,</quote> <trans><tr>is founded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 759</bibl></cit>: sedes saxo vetusto. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 478</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 260</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19049.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to fasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make firm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dente tenaci Ancora fundabat naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(genus humanum) Et majoribus et solidis magis ossibus intus Fundatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:928" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 928</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:828" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 828</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19049.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to found</hi>, <hi rend="ital">establish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confirm</hi> (class., esp. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">firmo, stabilio): illud vero maxime nostrum fundavit imperium et populi Romani nomen auxit, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 13, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quantis laboribus fundatum imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (rei publicae status) bonorum omnium conjunctione et auctoritate consulatus mei fixus et fundatus videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accurate non modo fundata verum etiam exstructa disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fundati a doctore,</quote> <trans><tr>thoroughly instructed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica praeclare fundata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui legibus urbem Fundavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:810" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 810</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eorum agro sedes fundare Bastarnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:57:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 57, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem, salutem, securitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:8:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus civile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuos Penates prole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:7:30" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 7, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">thalamos Tritonide nympha,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to marry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:65" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partis et fundatis amicitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 7:25" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundatae atque optime constitutae opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nitidis fundata pecunia villis,</quote> <trans><tr>well laid out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil veritate fundatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 11, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 161</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fundātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">durable</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n19049.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo fundatior erit ex arenato directura, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si permanetis in fide fundati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Col. 1, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19049.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: deflevi subitas fundatissimae familiae ruinas, Auct. Or. pro Domo, 36, 96.</sense></entryFree>
fundula: <entryFree id="n19050" type="gloss" key="fundu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a street without an outlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cul de sac</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fundo, quod exitum non habent ac pervium non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=145" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 145</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fundulus: <entryFree id="n19051" type="main" key="fundu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>fundus</etym>. * <sense id="n19051.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sausage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">FUNDULUM a fundo, quod non ut reliquae partes, sed ex una parte sola apertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=111" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 111</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n19051.1" n="II" level="1"> In mechanics, <hi rend="ital">a kind of sucker</hi> or <hi rend="ital">piston</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambulatiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fundus: <entryFree id="n19052" type="main" key="fundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fundus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. budh-nas, ground; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">puqmh/n, pu/ndac</foreign>; O. H. Germ. Bodam; Germ. Boden; v. fodio</etym>, <sense id="n19052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bottom</hi> of any thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n19052.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19052.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">armarii fundum exsecuit,</quote> <trans><tr>the bottom of the chest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ollae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 17, 18, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scyphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Aetna) fundo exaestuat imo,</quote> <trans><tr>from the lowest bottom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 577</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imo Nereus ciet aequora fundo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis fundo carens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:51:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 51, 17</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">largitio fundum non habet,</quote> <trans><tr>there is no end of giving</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 15, 55</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n19052.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (pars pro toto), <hi rend="ital">a cup</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi duo longaevo censentur Nestore fundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:6:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19052.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a piece of land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a farm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estate</hi> (syn.: praedium, villa): fundi appellatione omne aedificium et omnis ager continetur; sed in usu urbana aedificia aedes, rustica villae dicuntur; <cit><quote lang="la">locus vero sine aedificio in urbe area, rure autem ager appellatur: idemque ager cum aedificio fundus dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:211" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 211</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inprobata sit eorum sententia qui putaverint furtivum fundum fieri posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:51" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: non hominum tantum neque rerum moventium ... sed fundi quoque et aedium fieri furtum, Masur. Sab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui nostrum non licet fundos nostros obire?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunquam tam mane egredior, quin te in fundo conspicer fodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; Crass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 36, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:69:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 69, 2</bibl>; <pb n="794" /> <cb n="FUNE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:131" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcia poma feret cultus tibi fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">euge, fundi et aedes, per tempus subvenistis mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 84</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quidem habes fundum atque aedis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri fundi calamitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi non fundis exornatae multae incedant per vias,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with the price of a farm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unumne fundum pulcherrimum populi Romani, disperire patiemini?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc is nobis fundus est, i. e. ex quo fructus capiamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit> Spengel ad loc.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: fundum alienum arat, incultum familiarem deserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19052.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19052.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: fluxas Phrygiae res vertere fundo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">from its foundation</hi>, = funditus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenae,</quote> <trans><tr>the principal dish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19052.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., publicists' t. t., qs. <hi rend="ital">one who lays the foundation for the decision</hi> of a thing, <hi rend="ital">one that approves</hi> a thing or <hi rend="ital">ratifies</hi> it, <hi rend="ital">the approver</hi> (syn. auctor): fundus dicitur populus esse rei, quam alienat, hoc est auctor, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=89" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 89</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">non ut hujus sententiae legisque fundus fierem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat ex foederato populo quemquam potuisse, nisi is populus fundus factus esset, in hanc civitatem venire, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 8, 19</bibl></cit> (where Cicero gives to this legal principle another meaning); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim potuit dici imperitius quam foederatos populos fieri fundos oportere?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 20</bibl></cit>; 11, 27; <cit><quote lang="la">18, 42: municipes sunt cives Romani ex municipiis, legibus suis et suo jure utentes ... neque ulla populi Romani lege astricti, nisi populus eorum fundus factus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:13:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 13, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19052.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (ante- and post-class., and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quae cum ejus filio egi, ei rei fundus pater sit potior,</quote> <trans><tr>may officially confirm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 12</bibl>; and Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=89" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 89</bibl> Müll. supra.</sense></entryFree>
funebris: <entryFree id="n19053" type="main" key="fu_ne_^bris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnē^bris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>funus</etym>, <sense id="n19053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a funeral</hi>, <hi rend="ital">funeral</hi>-, <hi rend="ital">funereal</hi> (syn.: funerĕus, feralis; funestus, fatalis). </sense><sense id="n19053.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">epulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:18" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pompa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:84:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 84, 341</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:153" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 153</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">laudationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:2" default="NO">3, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19053.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnē^bria</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">funeral rites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 52, 53, § 177</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19053.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">deadly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruel</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>human offerings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:85" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 84, § 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum populis (elephantiasis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 1, 5, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficiles, funebria ligna, tabellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
funerarius: <entryFree id="n19054" type="main" key="fu_ne^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to a funeral</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n19054.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <trans><tr>on account of the expenses of a funeral</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:14:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 14, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21 al" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 21 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19054.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who took charge of funerals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an undertaker</hi>, Firm. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
funeraticius: <entryFree id="n19055" type="main" key="fu_ne^ra_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnĕrātīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to a funeral</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 30</bibl></cit> (al. funeraria, v. funerarius).—</sense><sense id="n19055.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <itype>FVNERATICIVM, ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the money spent on a funeral</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burial expenses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2417</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4107</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4420</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
funeratio: <entryFree id="n19056" type="main" key="fu_ne^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>funero</etym>, <sense id="n19056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">funeral</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Indi funerationes negligunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 696</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
funerator: <entryFree id="n19057" type="gloss" key="fu_ne^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnĕrātor</orth> <foreign lang="greek">khdeuth\s nekrou=</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
funerepus: <entryFree id="n19058" type="main" key="fu_ne^re_pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnĕrēpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. funirepus.</entryFree>
funereus: <entryFree id="n19059" type="main" key="fu_ne^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnĕrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>funus</etym>, <sense id="n19059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a funeral</hi>, <hi rend="ital">funeral</hi>- (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for the class. funebris, q. v.). </sense><sense id="n19059.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces,</quote> <trans><tr>funeral-torches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fronde coronat pyram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 506</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19059.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">deadly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destructive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra (Discordiae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:468" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bubo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ill-boding</tr>, <tr>dismal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os bubonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:226" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 226</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
funero: <entryFree id="n19060" type="main" key="fu_ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n19060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form funeratus est, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 14</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to bury with funeral rites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inter</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: sepelio, humo, effero): qui funerari se jussit sestertiis undecim milibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 10, 47, § 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Helv. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Helv. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:12:5" default="NO">12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:2" default="NO">4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:6:3 al" default="NO">4, 6, 3 al.</bibl>: (apes) defunctas progerunt <cb n="FUNG" /> funerantiumque more comitantur exsequias, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 20, § 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui funerari sepelirive aliquem prohibuerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 26, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19060.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (consequens pro antecedente), <orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">killed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroyed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope funeratus Arboris ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funerata est pars illa corporis, qua quondam Achilles eram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 129, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
funeror: <entryFree id="n19061" type="main" key="fu_ne^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnĕror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. funero <sense id="n19061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
funesto: <entryFree id="n19062" type="main" key="fu_nesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnesto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>funestus</etym>, <sense id="n19062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pollute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disgrace with murder.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19062.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. foedo): aras ac templa humanis hostiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aram sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 33, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contionem contagione carnificis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19062.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to pollute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">emptor veneni Frangenda miseram funestat imagine gentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:18" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese nuptiis incestis, Cod. Th. 3, 12, 3: corpus in civitatem inferri non licet, ne funestentur sacra civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
funestus: <entryFree id="n19063" type="main" key="fu_nestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>funus</etym>. <sense id="n19063.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">causing death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">calamity; causing grief; deadly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destructive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calamitous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mournful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dismal</hi> (class.; syn.: nefarius, perniciosus; <cit><quote lang="la">fatalis, fatifer): ad ejus (C. Verris) funestam securem servati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:47:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 47, § 123</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum templis atque delubris funestos ac nefarios ignes inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:521" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:373" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:432" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 432</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">taeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 50</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">funestior dies Alliensis pugnae, quam urbis captae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caligula sceleratissimus ac funestissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19063.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilam argenteam, quam tibi perniciosam et funestam futuram confido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o diem illum funestum senatui bonisque omnibus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 12, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nox nobis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 41, 103</bibl></cit>: victoria orbi terrarum, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19063.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filled with misfortune</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mournful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sad</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: infaustus, infelix, etc.): agros funestos reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:493" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utque manus funestas arceat aris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>polluted with blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 584</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <trans><tr>in mourning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47:10" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 47, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo ut annales velut funesti nihil praeter nomina consulum suggerant,</quote> <trans><tr>as if they were lists of the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 20, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. epistolae, <hi rend="ital">announcing misfortune</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sad tidings</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:117:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 117, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">funestior advolat alter Nuntius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 474</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturna volucris funesta querela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit> (3, 13), 5; <cit><quote lang="la">hence also: omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 28, 38</bibl></cit> (3, 25, 4 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">littera,</quote> <trans><tr>denoting death</tr>, <tr>mourning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 216</bibl></cit>: manus, <hi rend="ital">mourning</hi> (of a dowager), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:585" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 585</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">funestum est a forti atque honesto viro jugulari, funestius ab eo, cujus vox, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 31, 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
funetum: <entryFree id="n19064" type="main" key="fu_ne_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>funis</etym>, <sense id="n19064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vine trained so as to form an arbor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fungidus: <entryFree id="n19065" type="gloss" key="fungi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fungĭdus</orth> <foreign lang="greek">somfo/s</foreign> (<sense id="n19065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spongy</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
funginus: <entryFree id="n19066" type="main" key="fungi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fungĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fungus</etym>, <sense id="n19066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a mushroom;</hi> comic.: <cit><quote lang="la">pol hic quidem fungino genere est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
