fungor: <entryFree id="n19067" type="main" key="fungor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fungor</orth>, <itype>functus, fungi</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>kindred to Sanscr. bhuj-, frui</etym>, <sense id="n19067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to busy one's self with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be engaged in</hi> something; <hi rend="ital">to perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">do</hi> (syn.: administro, defungor); constr. with <case>abl.</case>, rarely with <case>acc.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19067.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n19067.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo (opportuna est), ut dolore careas et muneribus fungare corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">populari munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis perfectae perfecto munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 109</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 16, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 16, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 25, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 5 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificentissimā aedilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magisterio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potius barbarorum quam illius more,</quote> <trans><tr>to observe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funguntur officio,</quote> <trans><tr>perform</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officio rhetoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 29</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 109</bibl>: cum suam vicem functus officio sit, <hi rend="ital">had filled his own place</hi> as husband, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnationibus et acie feliciter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:95:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 95, 2</bibl></cit>: sacris, <cb n="FUNI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 224</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 18, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">periculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to have done with the food</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:791" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 791</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caede,</quote> <trans><tr>to murder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte,</quote> <trans><tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 583</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:49:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 49, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: fato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 559</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:17:14" default="NO">49, 17, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voto,</quote> <trans><tr>to pay a vow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungar vice cotis,</quote> <trans><tr>to serve instead of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicis partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter aevo functus senex (Nestor),</quote> <trans><tr>who had lived through</tr>, <tr>enjoyed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">functo longissima statione mortali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:131:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 131, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtute functi duces,</quote> <trans><tr>who have shown</tr>, <tr>exhibited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omni virtute functa (femina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">5.—Of things: possunt aliquando oculi non fungi suo munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 32, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquae (vocales) officio consonantium fungantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levissima quaeque (quaestio) primo loco fungitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 8</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res eadem perorationis vice fungitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 75</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19067.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (so always in Plaut. and Ter. except officiis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 12</bibl>; but in class. prose only once in Nep.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>): ingentia munera fungi, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 497, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. prol. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militare munus fungens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:1:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 1, 2 al.</bibl></cit>: officium, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 497, 16</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 129 Rib.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Titin.</author> ib. 6</bibl> (Com. Rel. v 48 ib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0146,001:ib. 13" default="NO"><author>Turp.</author> ib. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine me alliatum fungi fortunas meas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mago diem fungitur relictis duobus filiis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 19, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala multa animus contagibu' fungitur ejus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>suffers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 734</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19067.4" n="(g)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">gerundive</hi>, as <hi rend="ital">v.a.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">muneris fungendi gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:12:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad suum munus fungendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:7:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per speciem alienae fungendae vicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes facta militiae fungendae potioribus ducibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19067.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">at facere et fungi sine corpore nulla potest res,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to suffer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:443 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 443 sq.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so 3, 168: pro fultura et substructione fungentur fundamenta,</quote> <trans><tr>will serve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: nec livida tabes Invidiae functis quamquam et jam lumine cassis Defuit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to the dead</hi>, =defunctis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 15</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia functa Aut moritura vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:209" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 209</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:483" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 4, 483</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">511</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:1:393" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 1,393</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep.33</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n19067.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay</hi> any thing due from one: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vobis est statuendum, quid aratorem ipsum arationis nomine muneris in re publica fungi ac sustinere velitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:86:section=199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 86, § 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnes annos atque omnia bella duplici numero se militum equitumque fungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:15:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo sumptu res publica fungatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fenus exercent, omnibus patrimonii intributionibus fungi debent, etsi possessionem non habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:1:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>!*? In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif. (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pretia rerum non ex affectione, nec utilitate singulorum, sed communiter fungi,</quote> <trans><tr>are not taken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dos, quae semel functa est, amplius fungi non potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 6, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fungosus: <entryFree id="n19068" type="main" key="fungo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fungōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fungus</etym>, <sense id="n19068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of holes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spongy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fungous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raphanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 49</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 137</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
fungulus: <entryFree id="n19069" type="main" key="fungu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fungŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small mushroom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:2:section=190" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 5, 2, § 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:3:20:section=107" default="NO">3, 20, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fungus: <entryFree id="n19070" type="main" key="fungus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fungus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>for sfungus, kindred to <foreign lang="greek">sfo/ggos, spo/ggos</foreign>, the initial s suppressed as in fallo, fides, nurus, etc.; cf. funis, and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">S</ref></xr>.</etym>, <sense id="n19070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mushroom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moril</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fungus.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19070.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis esse nobis non magis hoc potis est quam imber fungo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19070.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19070.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A soft-pated fellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dolt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulti, stolidi, fatui, fungi, bardi, blenni, buccones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 49</bibl>; 4, 7, 23.—</sense><sense id="n19070.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fungous excrescence</hi> on the human body, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 23</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fungo simile ulcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 11</bibl></cit>.—On the olive-tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 223</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19070.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A collection of lamp-black on the wick of a candle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lamp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a candle-snuff</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 392</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
funicula: <entryFree id="n19071" type="main" key="fu_ni^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>funis</etym>, = funiculus, q. v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 100</bibl> P. <pb n="795" /> <cb n="FUNU" /></entryFree>
funiculus: <entryFree id="n19072" type="main" key="fu_ni^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>funis</etym>, <sense id="n19072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slender rope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cord</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:51:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 51, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:35:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 35, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
funirepus: <entryFree id="n19073" type="main" key="fu_ni^re_pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnĭrēpus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fūnĕrēp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>funisrepo, that climbs on a rope</etym>, <sense id="n19073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rope-dancer</hi>, =funambulus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 342, 18</bibl> and 32.</sense></entryFree>
funis: <entryFree id="n19074" type="main" key="fu_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n19074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1154</bibl>; ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 21</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 205, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl>) [perh. for fudnis, root in Sanscr. bandh-, bind; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pei=sma</foreign>, rope; kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">sxoi=nos</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">a rope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sheet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">line</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cord</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">restis, rudens): funes dicti, quod antea in usum luminis circumdati cera, unde et funalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 29, 3 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 262</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 777</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">patiatur necesse est illam per funes ingredientium tarditatem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the rope-dancers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 14, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19074.1" n="2" level="3"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n19074.2" n="a" level="4"> Funem ducere or sequi, <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">follow the rope</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to command</hi> or <hi rend="ital">serve</hi> (the fig. being most probably that of an animal led by a rope): <cit><quote lang="la">imperat aut servit collecta pecunia cuique, Tortum digna sequi potius quam ducere funem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19074.3" n="b" level="4"> Funem reducere, <hi rend="ital">to pull back the rope</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to change one's mind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:118" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 118</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19074.4" n="c" level="4"> Funem in diversa distendere, <hi rend="ital">to dispute pro and con</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 2</bibl>; adv. Marc. 4.—</sense><sense id="n19074.5" n="d" level="4"> Ut, quod aiunt Graeci, ex incomprehensibili parvitate arenae funise effici non possit (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)ca)/mmou sxoini/on ple/kein</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">to make a rope of sand</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to perform the impossible</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10 praef.</bibl> § 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
funus: <entryFree id="n19075" type="main" key="fu_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūnus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. dhū-mas, smoke; v. fumus</etym>, <sense id="n19075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a funeral procession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">funeral rites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">funeral</hi>, usually with reference to the burning of the body; cf.: funus est jam ardens cadaver; quod dum portatur, exsequias dicimus; crematum, reliquias; <cit><quote lang="la">conditum jam, sepulcrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 539</bibl></cit> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n19075.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus, quo amici conveniunt ad exsequias cohonestandas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mater exsequias illius funeris prosecuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:71:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 71, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus innumeris exsequiis celebratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 43, 60, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedem funeris ac sepulturae constituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:51:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 51, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maeror funeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui acerbissimum funus ducitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">funus triumphali portā ducendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celebrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterno funeri omnia justa solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funeri operam dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 1</bibl></cit>, B, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">venire in funus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: pro ea copia quae Athenis erat, funus ei (Marcello) satis amplum faciendum curavi, Serv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus militare alicui facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:43:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 43, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prodire (alicui) in funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:69:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 69, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">funere efferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 225</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetereunte funere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus crematum publico funere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec te in tua funera mater Produxi (= funus tuum duxi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus imagines Ducant triumphales tuum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>be borne at the head of the procession</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ipsum funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 18, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim a funere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 85</bibl></cit>.—Comically: fecisti funus med absente prandio: Cur ausu's facere, quoi ego adaeque heres eram? <hi rend="ital">have buried</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">devoured</hi> it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 2, 27</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera agitant, exsequia ititant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit>: nemo me lacrumis decoret, nec funera fletu Faxit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 34</bibl>, and de <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:20:73" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> 20, 73</bibl> (Epigr. 3, p. 162 Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">poetically imitated by Cicero: linquamus amicis Maerorem, ut celebrent funera cum gemitu, Cic. poët. Tusc. 1, 49, 117: cum senatus auctoritatem suam in virorum fortium funeribus ornamentisque ostenderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phil. 9:7:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edictum, quod de funeribus habeant (aediles curules),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">17: tristia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tria si concurrant foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justa reddere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:184" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 184</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19075.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19075.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A dead body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corpse</hi>, =cadaver （<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">haeccine parva meum funus arena teget?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 491</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, of <hi rend="ital">a corpse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:298" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 298</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mixta senum ac juvenum densentur funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 19</bibl></cit>; of <hi rend="ital">the manes</hi> of the departed: <cit><quote lang="la">cum semel infernas intrarunt funera leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 3.—</sense><sense id="n19075.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Death</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">violent death</hi>, <cb n="FURC" /> <hi rend="ital">murder</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">maturo propior ... funeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinum funus ut aegros Exanimat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstinctum Nymphae crudeli funere Daphnin Flebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(quos) Abstulit atra dies, et funere mersit acerbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui patrios foedasti funere vultus,</quote> <trans><tr>with murder</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 539</bibl></cit>.—Freq. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae funera Turnus Ediderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 526</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 602</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14, 49</bibl>; once in Cic., acc. to Nonius: ut vix hominum acerbis funeribus satietur, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 300, 26</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 41</bibl> Mos.).—</sense><sense id="n19075.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir summā eloquentiā dixit graviter, casum illum meum funus esse rei publicae, sed funus justum et indictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum Capitolio Regina (Cleopatra) dementes ruinas Funus et imperio parabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 8</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub lacrimosa Trojae Funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro dira pudoris funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 231</bibl></cit>.—Also concr. of persons plotting destruction: <cit><quote lang="la">Gabinium et Pisonem, duo rei publicae portenta ac paene funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fuo: <entryFree id="n19076" type="main" key="fuo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fuo</orth>, v. sum <sense id="n19076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fur: <entryFree id="n19077" type="main" key="fu_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūr</orth>, <itype>fūris</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>root fer-, v. fero; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fw/r</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 18</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n19077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thief</hi> (syn.: latro, praedo, pirata, raptor). </sense><sense id="n19077.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi duodecim tabulae nocturnum furem quoquo modo, diurnum autem, si se telo defenderet, interfici impune voluerunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: ita in legibus posiverunt, furem duplici comdemnari, feneratorem quadrupli, Cato, R. R. praef. § 1: fures privatorum furtorum, opp. fures publici, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes aluntur in Capitolio, ut significent, si fures venerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fures aerari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Philippo interrogatus, quid latraret, furem se videre respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Carbo condemnatus, fur magnus, e Sicilia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>extortioner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis fur esset, neu latro, neu quis adulter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Priapus) furum aviumque Maxima formido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sallustius historicus priscorum verborum ineruditissimus fur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fur tuos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who carried you off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 21</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fures estis ambae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19077.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19077.3" n="A" level="2"> As a term of vituperation applied to slaves, <hi rend="ital">thief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rascal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rogue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tun' trium litterarum homo Me vituperas? fur, etiam fur trifurcifer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non fur, sed trifur?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; 4, 10, 38 sc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 131</bibl> et saepe quid domini faciant, audent cum talia fures! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manipulus furum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19077.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A robber-bee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drone</hi>, usually called fucus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fura: <entryFree id="n19078" type="main" key="Fura"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fura</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a goddess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise unknown</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 164</bibl> (al. Furia).</sense></entryFree>
furacitas: <entryFree id="n19079" type="main" key="fu_ra_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūrācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>furax</etym>, <sense id="n19079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inclination to steal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thievish disposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thievishness</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">auri argentique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 41, § 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furaciter: <entryFree id="n19080" type="main" key="fu_ra_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūrācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. furax <sense id="n19080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
furator: <entryFree id="n19081" type="main" key="fu_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. furor</etym>, <sense id="n19081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thief</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis philosophus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
furatrina: <entryFree id="n19082" type="main" key="fu_ra_tri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūrātrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (post-class.), <sense id="n19082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stealing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 178</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>, p. 245.—</sense><sense id="n19082.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugalis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>adultery</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 202</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furax: <entryFree id="n19083" type="main" key="fu_rax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūrax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inclined to steal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">given to stealing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thievish</hi> (rare but class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rapax, furunculus): servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:61:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 61, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Cornelius homo avarus et furax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 66, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furacissimae manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:30:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 30, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est furacius illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:59:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 59, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam furax a mento volsella,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>removing the beard</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fūrācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">thievishly;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnium domos, apothecas, naves furacissime scrutarere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 5, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furca: <entryFree id="n19084" type="main" key="furca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. bhur-ig, shears; cf. Lat. forceps, forfex; also Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fa/ros</foreign>, plough; Lat. forāre; <cit><quote lang="la">Engl. bore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 299" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 299</bibl></cit>; but Corss. refers furca to root dhar-,=fero, as a prop. support; v. Ausspr. 1, 149</etym>, <sense id="n19084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a two-pronged fork.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19084.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exacuunt alii vallos furcasque bicornes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furcis detrudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 11, 2</bibl>. —Prov.: naturam expellas furcā, tamen <cb n="FURF" /> usque recurret, <hi rend="ital">with might and main</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 24</bibl> (v. furcilla).—</sense><sense id="n19084.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things shaped like a fork. </sense><sense id="n19084.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A forkshaped prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pole</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">stake</hi>, for carrying burdens on the back or shoulder, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for supporting the seats of a theatre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for a vine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 32</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for fishing-nets,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 9, § 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for the gable of a house,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 700</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a frame on which meat was suspended in the chimney</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:648" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 648</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19084.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An instrument of punishment in the form of a fork</hi> (V or II), <hi rend="ital">which was placed on the culprit's neck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">while his hands were fastened to the two ends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a yoke</hi> (cf.: crux, gabalus, patibulum; hence, furcifer): <hi rend="ital">To.</hi> Satis sumpsimus jam supplici. <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Fateor, manus vobis do. <hi rend="ital">To.</hi> Post dabis sub furcis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canem et furcam ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus per circum, cum virgis caederetur, furcam ferens ductus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:26:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 26, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus sub furca caesus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36, 1</bibl></cit> Drak.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 7, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub furca vinctus inter verbera et cruciatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervicem inserere furcae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 5</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 851.—Hence <usg type="style">poet.</usg> to designate the worst condition of slavery: <cit><quote lang="la">ibis sub furcam prudens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19084.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fork-shaped gallows</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem furcā figere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furcae subicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in furcam tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in furcam suspendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in furcam damnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 49, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes vivi in furca, sambucea arbore fixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29</bibl></cit>. 4, 14, § 57.—</sense><sense id="n19084.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fork-shaped yoke</hi> in which young bullocks were put to be tamed, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:20:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 20, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19084.7" n="E" level="2"> Furcae cancrorum, <hi rend="ital">the claws of a crab</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 297</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19084.8" n="F" level="1"> Furcae Caudinae, <hi rend="ital">the narrow pass of Caudium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Caudine Forks</hi>, usually called Furculae Caudinae (v. furcula, II. and Caudium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> 7, 2, 17 <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi></sense></entryFree>
furcifer: <entryFree id="n19085" type="main" key="furci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furcĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>furca+fero; acc. to furca, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n19085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a yoke-bearer</hi>, as a term of vituperation, usually of slaves, <hi rend="ital">gallows rogue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hang-dog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rascal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impudice, sceleste, verbero, bustirape, furcifer, Sociofraude, parricida, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:59 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 59 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 12</bibl> Don.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 9, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 22</bibl> et saep.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of freemen: id tu tibi, furcifer, sumes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Piso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 7, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furcifera: <entryFree id="n19086" type="hapax" key="furci^fe^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furcĭfĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>furca+fero</etym>, i. q. membrum virile, Petr. poët. Sat. 132, 8.</entryFree>
furcilla: <entryFree id="n19087" type="main" key="furcilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furcilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>furca</etym>, <sense id="n19087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little fork</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba subsecari falcibus debet et, quoad perarescat, furcillis versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:49:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 49, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:8:6" default="NO">1, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam furcillā extrudimur, Brundisium cogito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">musae furcillis praecipitem eiciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:105:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 105, 2</bibl></cit>.—Also, ‡furcilles, sive ‡furcilla, quibus homines suspendebant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=88" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 88</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
furcillatus: <entryFree id="n19088" type="hapax" key="furcilla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furcillātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>furcilla</etym>, <sense id="n19088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pointed like a fork</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bacilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=117" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 117</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
furcillo: <entryFree id="n19089" type="hapax" key="furcillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furcillo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to support</hi> (qs. by a crotch).—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu inventus vero, meam qui furcilles fidem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furcosus: <entryFree id="n19090" type="hapax" key="furco_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>furca</etym>, <sense id="n19090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of forks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">points</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">thyrsi leontopodii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furcula: <entryFree id="n19091" type="main" key="furcu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>furca, II.</etym>. <sense id="n19091.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A forked prop</hi> to support a wall when undermined: <cit><quote lang="la">suspenso furculis ab hostibus muro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19091.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Furculae Caudinae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">two lofty</hi> (fork-shaped) <hi rend="ital">defiles near Caudium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the Roman army</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the year</hi> A.U.C. 434, <hi rend="ital">was hemmed in by the Samnites</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Casale di Forchia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes">11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16</bibl>; v. Caudium.</sense></entryFree>
furenter: <entryFree id="n19092" type="main" key="fu^renter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. furo <sense id="n19092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
furfur: <entryFree id="n19093" type="main" key="furfur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furfur</orth>, <itype>ŭris</itype> (<case>abl.</case> furfuri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 27</bibl>), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">furfŭres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bran</hi> [reduplicated form, originally for-for; root ghar-; Sanscr. gharshāmi, rub; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xri/w</foreign>; cf.: far, farina, frio, frico, etc.; v. Corss. Beiträg. p. 206]. </sense><sense id="n19093.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui alunt furfure sues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per cribrum effuso furfure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 70, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triticum furfure crasso vestitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 304</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeacei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:6:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 44, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triticei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excreti modice a farina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <pb n="796" /> <cb n="FURI" /> furfuribus conspersus panis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 18, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19093.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">scurf</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scales</hi> on the skin, the head, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">foedo cutis furfure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 1, 2, § 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 39, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in facie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 21, 30, § 64</bibl></cit>. —In a pun upon the two meanings: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ipsis dominis meis pugnis exculcabo furfures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furfuraceus: <entryFree id="n19094" type="main" key="furfu^ra_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furfŭrācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>furfur</etym>, <sense id="n19094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like bran</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">terebramina tinearum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furfurarius: <entryFree id="n19095" type="gloss" key="furfu^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furfŭrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to bran</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">PECVNIA,</quote> <trans><tr>from the sale of bran</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 128, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furfureus: <entryFree id="n19096" type="main" key="furfu^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furfŭrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of bran</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made of bran</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bran-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furfuriculae: <entryFree id="n19097" type="main" key="furfu^ri^cu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furfŭrĭcŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fine bran</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
furfurosus: <entryFree id="n19098" type="main" key="furfu^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furfŭrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like bran</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brownish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color (styracis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 55, § 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furia: <entryFree id="n19099" type="main" key="fu^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and, more commonly, <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>furo</etym>, <sense id="n19099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">violent passion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">madness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fury.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19099.1" n="I" level="1"> Appellatively (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for furor or rabies): <cit><quote lang="la">unius ob noxam et furias Ajacis Oï_lei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi concepit furias,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>became furious</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 474</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:43:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 43, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in furias agitantur equae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>furious</tr>, <tr>ardent desire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 478</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 4, 68: <cit><quote lang="la">auri,</quote> <trans><tr>the fierce greediness for gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:500" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 500</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo omnis furiis surrexit Etruria justis,</quote> <trans><tr>in just fury</tr>, <tr>just wrath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestae (Sagunti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:84" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 84</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of things: tranare sonoras Torrentum furias,</quote> <trans><tr>the wild raging</tr>, <tr>roaring</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19099.2" n="II" level="1"> As a <hi rend="ital">nom. prop.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fŭrĭae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the three goddesses of vengeance</hi> (Allecto, Megaera, and Tisiphone), <hi rend="ital">the Furies</hi> (syn.: Dirae, Eumenides). </sense><sense id="n19099.3" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Furiae deae sunt speculatrices, credo, et vindices facinorum et scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eos agitent insectenturque Furiae, non ardentibus taedis, sicut in fabulis sed angore conscientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 14, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:66 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 66 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 20, 46</bibl>; Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 331</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 135</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 8, 45 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19099.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">avenging spirits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tormenting spirits.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19099.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque eos non ad perficiendum scelus sed ad luendas rei publicae poenas furiae quaedam incitaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:27:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Furiae Catilinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleratum vicum vocant, quo amens, agitantibus furiis sororis ac viri, Tullia per patris corpus carpentum egisse fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">his muliebribus instinctus furiis Tarquinius circumire et prensare patres, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>urged on by this female tormenting spiril</tr>, <tr>this fury of a woman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 47, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19099.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, applied to persons who are furious or who are plotting mischief, <hi rend="ital">a fury.</hi>—So of Clodius: <cit><quote lang="la">illa furia ac pestis patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 14, 33</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the same,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: illa furia muliebrium religionum, qui non pluris fecerat Bonam Deam quam tres sorores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc juvenem (i. e. Hannibalem) tamquam furiam facemque hujus belli odi ac detestor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furialis: <entryFree id="n19100" type="main" key="fu^ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>furiae</etym>. <sense id="n19100.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Furies</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">like the Furies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreadful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fearful</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: furiosus, furibundus, fanaticus): Alecto torvam faciem et furialia membra Exuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput Cerberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Bacchantes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 591</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Erichtho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furialis illa vox (Clodii) nefariis stupris effeminata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira exsecratio ac furiale carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 657</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod pretium speret pro tam furialibus ausis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:75:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 75, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae Atrei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 12, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollitur in caelum furiali turbine clamor,</quote> <trans><tr>fearful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:320" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 320</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">aurigae furiale minetur Efferus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:429" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 429</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 326</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19100.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">making mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infuriating</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">haec me irretivit veste furiali inscium, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 8, 20: aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:670" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:254" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 254</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">furiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">madly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">franticly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:637" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 637</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furialiter: <entryFree id="n19101" type="main" key="fu^ri^a_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n19101.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="FURI" /></sense></entryFree>
furianus: <entryFree id="n19102" type="main" key="Fu_ri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fūrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Furius, II. B.</entryFree>
furiatilis: <entryFree id="n19103" type="main" key="fu^ri^a_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>furiae</etym>, <sense id="n19103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">raging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi> (late Lat.): cornu (vaccae furentis), Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:306" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 306</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
furiatus: <entryFree id="n19104" type="main" key="fu^ri^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. 1. furio.</entryFree>
furibunde: <entryFree id="n19105" type="main" key="fu^ri^bunde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭbundē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. furibundus <sense id="n19105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
furibundus: <entryFree id="n19106" type="main" key="fu^ri^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭbundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>furo</etym>, <sense id="n19106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">raging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi> (rare but class.; syn. v. furialis). </sense><sense id="n19106.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ac perditus (Clodius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ille (Catilina) furibundus: Quoniam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:871" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 871</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignibus et ventis furibundus fluctuet aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum semel accepit solem furibundus (Leo) acutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latronis impetus crudeles ac furibundos retardare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:896" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 896</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n19106.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">filled with prophetic inspiration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspired</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hariolorum et vatum furibundae praedictiones (shortly before: furente modo and furor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭbunde</orth>, <hi rend="ital">furiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes furibunde concutiens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jesai. 5, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furina: <entryFree id="n19107" type="main" key="Furi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Furīna</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Furrīna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess worshipped in ancient Rome</hi>, otherwise unknown: <cit><quote lang="la">Furrinalia Furrinae, quod ei deae feriae reipublicae dies is, quojus deae honos apud antiquos. Nam ei sacra instituta annua et flamen attributus: nunc vix nomen notum paucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 19</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (Eumenidum) et Athenis fanum est et apud nos. ut ego interpretor, lucus Furinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponticulus, qui est ad Furinae, Satricum versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19107.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Furī-nālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Furrīn-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Furina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Furinal-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:7:section=45" default="NO">7, § 45</bibl> Müll.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Furī-nālia</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Furrīn-</orth>), <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of Furina</hi> (celebrated on the 25th of July), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 19</bibl>; Calend. Maff. ap. Inscr. Orell. II. pp. 394 and 411; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=88" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 88</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
furinus: <entryFree id="n19108" type="hapax" key="fu_ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fur</etym>, <sense id="n19108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to thieves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thief</hi>- (a word formed in jest after the analogy of coquinus): <cit><quote lang="la">non coquinumst, verum furinum forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furio: <entryFree id="n19109" type="main" key="fu^ri^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>furiae</etym>, <sense id="n19109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to madden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enrage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infuriate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">flagrans amor et libido, Quae solet matres furiare equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:280" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres armatas (i. e. Bacchantes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:488" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes in iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:294" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 294</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">enraged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maddened</hi> (syn. v. furialis): <cit><quote lang="la">furiata mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 407</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">588</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes malis incursibus furiatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:21" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furiata juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:617" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 617</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furiati ignes (amoris),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fierce</tr>, <tr>wild</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:761" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 761</bibl></cit> (al. furiales); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:209" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 209</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19110" type="main" key="fu^ri^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rage</hi> (late Lat. for furere): <cit><quote lang="la">ut furiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 22, 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furiose: <entryFree id="n19111" type="main" key="fu^ri^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. furiosus <sense id="n19111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
furiosus: <entryFree id="n19112" type="main" key="fu^ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>furiae</etym>, <sense id="n19112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of madness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi> (freq. and class.; syn. v. furialis): lex XII.
