Tabularum) est: SI FVRIOSVS EST, AGNATORVM GENTILIVMQVE IN EO PECVNIAQVE EIVS POTESTAS ESTO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 50, 148</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque non est scriptum: SI INSANVS, sed: SI FVRIOSVS ESCIT, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te non vecordem, non furiosum, non mente captum putem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aiunt hominem, ut erat furiosus, respondisse, etc. (shortly before: hominem longe audacissimum et insanissimum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 12, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 222</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">207</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">303</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dormientium et vinolentorum et furiosorum visa imbecilliora esse quam vigilantium, siccorum, sanorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier jam non morbo sed scelere furiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:65:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 65, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furiosus vultus et acer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si delira haec furiosaque cernimus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:985" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 985</bibl></cit>; Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exululant comites, furiosaque tibia flatur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>inciting to frenzy</tr>, <tr>maddening</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:341" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevam involvere togā, etc. ... paene furiosum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:146" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 146</bibl></cit>: quaedam pars exercitus non minus furiosa est, quam qui cum Antonio fuerunt, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello furiosa Thrace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditas effrenata ac furiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: fervido quodam et petulanti et <cb n="FURO" /> furioso genere dicendi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:241" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 68, 241</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vociferatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 370</bibl></cit>.—Esp., in law, <hi rend="ital">insane</hi>, =non compos mentis: <cit><quote lang="la">furiosus mutusve morbosi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furiosus nullum negotium gerere potest, quia non intelligit quid agat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:106" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infans non multum a furioso differt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 3:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 17, 10</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furiosior amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 737</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto hoc furiosius atque Majus peccatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 83</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi eum furiosissimum judicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contiones furiosissimae Publii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭōse</orth>, <hi rend="ital">furiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">madly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi solet eum, cum aliquid furiose fecit, paenitere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servo in se cum gladio furiosius irruente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 12, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furiositas: <entryFree id="n19113" type="main" key="fu^ri^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrĭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>furiosus</etym>, <sense id="n19113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil turpius m pastore furiositate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pseudo</author> August. ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furius: <entryFree id="n19114" type="main" key="Fu_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fūrĭus</orth> (archaic <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fūsius</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; cf. the letter R), a, <sense id="n19114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman family name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19114.1" n="1" level="3"> M. Furius Camillus, <hi rend="ital">the deliverer of Rome from the Gauls</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:19 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 19 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19114.2" n="2" level="3"> M. Furius Bibaculus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman poet of Cremona</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Cicero.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n19114.3" n="3" level="3"> A. Furius Antias, <hi rend="ital">a poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the friend of Q. Lutatius Catulus the elder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:35:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 35, 132</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19114.4" n="4" level="3"> L. Furius Philus, <hi rend="ital">consul in the year</hi> 618 A.U.C., <hi rend="ital">who is introduced as a speaker in Cicero's Republic</hi> al.—</sense><sense id="n19114.5" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19114.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fūrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Fūsius</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Furius</hi> (Fusius), <hi rend="ital">Furian</hi> (Fusian): <cit><quote lang="la">data fato quodam Furiae genti Gallica bella, Liv 31, 48, 12: cedo mihi leges Atinias, Furias, Fusias (al. Fufias),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:42:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 42, § 109</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lex Furia (testamentaria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:225" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 225</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:4:23" default="NO">4, 23</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">lex Furia Caninia (de manumissionibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: lex Fusia Caninia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19114.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fūrĭānus</orth> <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Furian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmata,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the poet A. Furius Antias</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fūrĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the soldiers of M. Furius Camillus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Furians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 9, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
furnacarius: <entryFree id="n19115" type="gloss" key="furna_ca_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furnācārius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. fornacarius.</entryFree>
furnacator: <entryFree id="n19116" type="gloss" key="furna_ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furnācātor</orth>, v. fornacator.</entryFree>
furnaceus: <entryFree id="n19117" type="hapax" key="furna_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furnācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>furnus</etym>, <sense id="n19117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an oven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baked in an oven</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 27, § 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furnaria: <entryFree id="n19118" type="main" key="furna_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furnārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the trade of a baker</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furnariam exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl></cit>: castrensis, Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 42, 43, § 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
furnarius: <entryFree id="n19119" type="main" key="furna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a baker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:24:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 24, § 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2868</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
furnius: <entryFree id="n19120" type="main" key="Furni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Furnĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n19120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n19120.1" n="1" level="3"> C. Furnius, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 6 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19120.2" n="2" level="3"> Furnius, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Horace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
furnus: <entryFree id="n19121" type="main" key="furnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furnus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">fornus</orth>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 531, 32</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. ghar-, to lighten; cf.: fornus, fornax, and v. formus</etym>, <sense id="n19121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oven</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">caminus, fornax, clibanus): in furnum calidum condito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malim istius modi mi amicos furno mersos quam foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; Varr. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:18" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 1, 3, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:99" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 9, 39, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:313" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 313</bibl>. Used by the Romans as a warming-place, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
furo: <entryFree id="n19122" type="main" key="fu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭro</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype> (<sense id="n19122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> rare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Orest. 846" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Orest. 846</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 41 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">usually supplied by insanivi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 376</bibl></cit> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 817</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur. part. sync.</hi> furentum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:838" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 838</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qou=ros</foreign>, hasty; <foreign lang="greek">qorei=n, qrw/skw</foreign>, to leap; cf. <foreign lang="greek">qhr</foreign>, wild; Lat. fera, ferox; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 256" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 256</bibl></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rave</hi> (in sickness or when in a passion), <hi rend="ital">to be out of one's mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi> (syn.: insanio, deliro, desipio). </sense><sense id="n19122.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): quem nos furorem, <foreign lang="greek">melagxoli/an</foreign> illi (Graeci) vocant: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi vero atra bili solum mens ac non saepe vel iracundiā graviore vel timore vel dolore moveatur: quo genere Athamantem, Alcmaeonem, Ajacem, Orestem furere dicimus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est aliud furere, non cognoscere homines, non cognoscere leges, non senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 20, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui valetudinis vitio furunt et melancholici dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:38:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 38, 81</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum inquiram, quid sit furere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanire ac furere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furere et bacchari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 80</bibl></cit>, <pb n="797" /> <cb n="FURO" /> 276; cf.: non ego sanius Bacchabor Edonis: recepto Dulce mihi furere est amico, <hi rend="ital">to play the fool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">act foolishly</hi> (an imitation of the Anacreontic <foreign lang="greek">qe/lw qe/lw manh=nai</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Telamon iratus furere luctu filii videretur,</quote> <trans><tr>to be distracted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille, si non acerrime fureret, auderet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 21, 50</bibl></cit>: furere adversus aliquem, Tiber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">num furis? an prudens ludis me obscura canendo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furit ille dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:427" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 427</bibl></cit>; cf.: ex quo destiti Inachia furere, <hi rend="ital">to be madly in love with</hi> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mai/nesqai e)pi/ tini</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:6" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 289" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in celeres iambos Misit (me) furentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19122.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Clodius) furebat, a Racilio se contumaciter urbaneque vexatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furit vinci dominus profundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 597" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce furit te reperire atrox Tydides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19122.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc sine me furere ante furorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipuum tunc caedis opus, Gradive, furebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:5" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19122.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. things (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">nubes interdum perscissa furit petulantibus auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 111</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">furit mugitibus aether concussus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus Aetnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 593</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma in Aetna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:33" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis in stipulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella vesani leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atra tempestas effusis imbribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 694</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furit aestus harenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae furentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furit ardor edendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:828" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 828</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec copia argenti tantum furit vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 53, § 147</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama furit, versos hostes Poenumque salutem Invenisse fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:504" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 504</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭrenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">furiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri autem aiunt eum furenter irasci,</quote> <trans><tr>was furiously enraged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furor: <entryFree id="n19123" type="main" key="fu_ror1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n19123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">act. inf.</hi> furasse, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 6</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> furatum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 22</bibl>: furatus, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 220</bibl>) [fur], <hi rend="ital">to steal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purloin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pilfer</hi> (syn.: latrocinor, clepo, rapio). </sense><sense id="n19123.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">solet haec, quae rapuit et furatus est dicere se emisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:22:section=60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 22, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furatur aliquid aut eripit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam ex templo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad furandum venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">pillaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">military raids</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille robore exercitus inpar, furandi melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 74 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of literary theft: ut iste in furando manibus suis uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:15:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 15, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ego tuum (librum) ante legissem, furatum me abs te esse diceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19123.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to take away by stealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to withdraw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone caput, fessosque oculos furare labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:845" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 845</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:74" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:561" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus veste,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to hide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 914" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 914</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim furatus esse civitatem, non genus suum ementitus dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciem furabor Iacchi,</quote> <trans><tr>will represent</tr>, <tr>personate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 31: <cit><quote lang="la">audiendi facultatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to obtain by stealth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19124" type="main" key="fu^ror2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭror</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>furo</etym>, <sense id="n19124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a raging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raving</hi> (in sickness or violent passion), <hi rend="ital">rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">madness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fury.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19124.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: hanc insaniam (<foreign lang="greek">mani/an</foreign>), quae juncta stultitiae patet latius, a furore disjungimus... Quem nos furorem, <foreign lang="greek">melagxoli/an</foreign> illi (Graeci) vocant ... Qui ita sit affectus, eum dominum esse rerum suarum vetant duodecim tabulae. Itaque non est scriptum: <cit><quote lang="la">Si INSANVS, sed: SI FVRIOSVS ESCIT. Stultitiam enim censuerunt insaniam, constantiā, id est sanitate vacantem ... furorem autem esse rati sunt mentis ad omnia caecitatem: quod cum majus esse videatur quam insania, tamen ejusmodi est, ut furor in sapientem cadere possit, non possit insania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira furor brevis est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fere ira et concitatio furori sunt similia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic si mentis esset suae, nisi poenas patriae furore atque insania penderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 21, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">furore atque amentiā impulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versatur mihi ante oculos aspectus Cethegi et furor in vestra caede bacchantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeci furore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 22, 14</bibl></cit>; <cb n="FURT" /> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 197</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 63, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec se comitem illius furoris, sed ducem praebuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: si decima legio ad eundem furorem redierit, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 11, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of political excitement,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 29, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 25, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 17</bibl>; of the <hi rend="ital">fierce passion</hi> of love, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 13, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 145</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille puellarum, puerorum mille furores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 325</bibl></cit>; of the <hi rend="ital">inspired frenzy</hi> of prophets and poets (as translation of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mani/a</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">ea (praesagitio) si exarsit acrius, furor appellatur, cum a corpore animus abstractus divino instinctu concitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat sine furore Democritus quemquam poëtam magnum esse posse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille furor (Cassandrae) patriae fuit utilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit> (4, 12), 65.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatidicos concepit mente furores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hunc impendiorum furorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">furor fit laesa saepius patientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:178" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 178</bibl></cit> Rib.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> also in a good sense: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi animos, mortesque virŭm, decorisque furorem,</quote> <trans><tr>vehement desire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:324" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 324</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen incautos laudum exhorresce furores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:146" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 146</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli furor aequinoctialis,</quote> <trans><tr>the raging storms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 46, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19124.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Furor est, <hi rend="ital">it is madness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">folly;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quis furor est, census corpore ferre suo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor est, mensuram ejus (mundi) animo quosdam agitasse atque prodere ausos ... furor est, profecto furor, egredi ex eo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno furor (leonis) est in sanguine mergi,</quote> <trans><tr>raging desire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:596" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 596</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplexne furor (est) sestertia centum perdere et, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>is it not worse than folly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19124.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the cause of wrath</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">non ita saeva ira mea ut tibi sim merito semper furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19124.4" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fŭror</orth>, <itype>personified</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 294</bibl>; cf. v. 348; as <hi rend="ital">a deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the companion of Mars</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:327" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 327</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:424" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 424</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 52</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:124" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
furrina: <entryFree id="n19125" type="main" key="Furri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Furrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Furrīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Furina.</entryFree>
furtificus: <entryFree id="n19126" type="main" key="furti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furtĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>furtum-facio</etym>, <sense id="n19126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that commits theft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thievish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus jam furtificus sum quam antehac: rapio propalam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furtim: <entryFree id="n19127" type="main" key="furtim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furtim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>fur; hence, like a thief, i. e.</etym>, <sense id="n19127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by stealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privily</hi> (rare but class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clam, clanculum, furtive): at enim hic clam furtim esse volt, ne qui sciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine lictoribus profectum clam furtim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 63, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut furtim tota decemviris traditur!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: quae (lagenae) furtim essent exsiccatae, Q. Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 26, 2</bibl>: alterum genus est imitatione; <cit><quote lang="la">admodum ridiculum, sed nobis tantum licet furtim, si quando, et cursim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:62:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 62, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Janua) neu furtim verso cardine aperta sones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>. 10: <cit><quote lang="la">quid juvat, immensum te argenti pondus et auri Furtim defossā timidum deponere terrā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per infrequentiam furtim senatusconsultum factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc in Aristippi furtim praecepta relabor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtim magis quam bello Marsacos incursabat,</quote> <trans><tr>by stealthy incursions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtim et per latrocinia ad honores nituntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtim et celeritate proelium vitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 65</bibl></cit> Dietsch. —* </sense><sense id="n19127.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, connected with a noun in the Greek manner: <cit><quote lang="la">concubitusque tuos furtim,</quote> <trans><tr>secret</tr>, <tr>clandestine intercourse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:53" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furtive: <entryFree id="n19128" type="main" key="furti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furtīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. furtivus <sense id="n19128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
furtivus: <entryFree id="n19129" type="main" key="furti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>furtum</etym>, <sense id="n19129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stolen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purloined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pilfered</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n19129.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui scias mercari furtivas atque ingenuas virgines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalis mulier, advecta ex Arabia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haecine illa est furtiva virgo?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> v. 83: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strigilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula rari capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:5:69" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 5, 69</bibl></cit> (5, 5, 71 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 39, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19129.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furtive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clandestine</hi> (class.): furtivum iter per Italiam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">expeditiones (with latrocinia, opp. bella),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:31:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 265</bibl></cit>: <cb n="FURV" /> scriptum, <hi rend="ital">cipher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <trans><tr>favorable to secrecy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem Rhea sacerdos Furtivum partu sub luminis edidit oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celent furtivos balnea tuta viros,</quote> <trans><tr>secret</tr>, <tr>concealed lovers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 56</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">furtīve</orth>, <hi rend="ital">stealthily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furtively</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: furtim, clam, secreto, occulte): clam furtive aliquid accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam furtive agunt gratias et in angulo et ad aurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">data munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furtum: <entryFree id="n19130" type="main" key="furtum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fur</etym>, <sense id="n19130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">theft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">robbery</hi> (class. and freq.; syn.: latrocinium, raptum). </sense><sense id="n19130.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: fures privatorum furtorum in nervo atque in compedibus aetatem agunt: fures publici in auro atque in purpura, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 18</bibl>: SI NOX FVRTVM FACTVM SIT, SI IM OCCISIT IVRE CAESVS ESTO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba sunt Sabini ... Qui alienam rem adtrectavit, cum id se invito domino facere judicare deberet, furti tenetur. Item alio capite: Qui alienum tacens lucri faciendi causa sustulit, furti obstringitur, sive scit cujus sit, sive nescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:20 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 20 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 195</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtum facere (alicui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Strato domi furtum fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 179</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:16" default="NO">5, 10, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:69" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 69</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">furti se et illum astringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">furti se alligare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in furto comprehensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furti teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:78" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furti agere, ib.: furti condemnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furti reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:29" default="NO">7, 2, 29</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">furtum erat apertum: cujus rei furtum factum erat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:9:26 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 9, 26 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi oves furto periere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">callidum (Mercurium), quicquid placuit, jocoso Condere furto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19130.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19130.3" n="A" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a stolen thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (furta) sine portorio Syracusis erant exportata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est turpius ingenuo quam in conventu maximo cogi furtum reddere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">58: dum (puer) furta ligurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19130.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A secret action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crafty deceit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stratagem</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n19130.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: etiam si, quid scribas, non habebis, scribito tamen, ne furtum cessationis quaesivisse videaris, <hi rend="ital">a secret excuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretext</hi>, Q. Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 26, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec obsides, pignus futuros furto et fraude agendae rei, posceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haud furto melior, sed fortibus armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 735</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furto, non proelio opus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:15" default="NO">4, 4, 15</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: furtum armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:91" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fugam) abscondere furto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furto laetatus inani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 568</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec semel ergo mihi furtum fecisse licebit?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to eat in secret</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:50:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 50, 5</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtis incautum decipit hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 104</bibl></cit>: furta belli, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 515</bibl>; and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 310, 15</bibl> (Hist. 1, 86 Dietsch); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 515</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n19130.6" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">furtō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, i. q. furtim, <hi rend="ital">by stealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">la/qra</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego sum furto tibi cognita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 43</bibl></cit>: obsides Porsenae dedistis; <cit><quote lang="la">furto eos subduxistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hyaenae) gravidae latebras petunt et parere furto cupiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 30, 46, § 108</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n19130.7" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">stolen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">secret love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrigue</hi> (mostly in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">plurima furta Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 136</bibl></cit> and 140; so in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:34" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 30</bibl> (3, 28), 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 346</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 606</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 558 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc certe conjux furtum mea nesciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 423</bibl></cit>; so in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:623" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 623</bibl>; 3, 266; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:487" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 487</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:615 al" default="NO">13, 615 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
furunculus: <entryFree id="n19131" type="main" key="fu_runcu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūruncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a petty thief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pilferer</hi> (cf. furax). </sense><sense id="n19131.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">olim furunculus, nunc etiam rapax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19131.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19131.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burning sore on the human body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a boil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furuncle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 50, § 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19131.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A germ</hi> or <hi rend="ital">knob on a vine</hi>, so called from its shape, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:5" default="NO">4, 24, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 36, § 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
furvescens: <entryFree id="n19132" type="main" key="furvescens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furvescens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [furvus], <sense id="n19132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">growing dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dusky</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Tartareae noctis obscuritate furvescens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
furvus: <entryFree id="n19133" type="main" key="furvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">furvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>akin with fuscus</etym>, <sense id="n19133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dusky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swarthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">black</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres Romani furvum atrum appellaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:18:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: furvum nigrum vel atrum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=84" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 84</bibl> Müll.; and: furvum bovem id est nigrum immolabant <pb n="798" /> <cb n="FUSI" /> Aterno, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=93" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 93</bibl> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n19133.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 461</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Acheronte suo furvis peperisse sub antris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 541</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the lower world: postis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:10" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagae leti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:155" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 5, 1, 155</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Proserpina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=93" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 93</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">furvā gente (i. e. Maurorum, Indorum) petita belua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:104" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19133.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">audivimus detestabili parricidio furvum diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 1, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fuscator: <entryFree id="n19134" type="hapax" key="fusca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fuscātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fusco</etym>, <sense id="n19134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a darkener</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscurer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli (Corus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fuscina: <entryFree id="n19135" type="main" key="fusci^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fuscĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with furca</etym>, <sense id="n19135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a three-pronged spear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trident</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dant (deo) arcum, sagittas, hastam, clipeum, fuscinam, fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 101</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">as an attribute of Neptune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 52</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">as a weapon of the retiarii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 143</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fuscinula: <entryFree id="n19136" type="main" key="fusci^nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fuscĭnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>fuscina</etym>, <sense id="n19136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small three-pronged fork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:27:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 27, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
fuscinus: <entryFree id="n19137" type="main" key="Fusci_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fuscīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Fuscus, II.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19138" type="main" key="Fusci_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fuscīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a friend of Juvenal to whom his fourteenth Satire is addressed</hi>, v. 1.</sense></entryFree>
fuscitas: <entryFree id="n19139" type="main" key="fusci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fuscĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fuscus</etym>, <sense id="n19139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">darkness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscurity</hi> (post-class. and very rare), App. de Mundo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fusco: <entryFree id="n19140" type="main" key="fusco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fusco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n19140.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swarthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dusky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blacken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">darken</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n19140.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuscentur corpora campo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 513</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem pingui olivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:576" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactea pocula sanguine puniceo (Massagetae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achil. 1, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malas (lanugo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 135</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dentes (inertia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem (nube),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:396" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 396</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:270" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 270</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19140.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ad hoc aevi nulla actuum culpa fuscavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:34" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 7, 505</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n19140.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become dark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">swarthy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne pulchrae fuscaret gratia formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:66" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fuscus: <entryFree id="n19141" type="main" key="fuscus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fuscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for fur-scus; cf. furvus, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 304" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 304</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n19141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swarthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dusky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tawny</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus, niger): purpura plebeia ac paene fusca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornix, id. poët. Div. 1, 8, 14: illi sint comites fusci, quos India torret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Andromede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hydaspes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also transf.: Syene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:36:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 36, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 286</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alae noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 369</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf.: amictus (somni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Falerna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:40:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 40, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">altera (fraxinus), brevis, durior fusciorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 13, 24, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dark</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:62" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 62</bibl></cit>.—As denoting misfortune: <cit><quote lang="la">fuscis avibus Larissam accessi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19141.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the voice, <hi rend="ital">indistinct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hoarse</hi> (opp. candidus): <cit><quote lang="la">et vocis genera permulta: candidum (al. canorum) fuscum, leve asperum, grave acutum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 58, 146</bibl></cit> Mos. and Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">est (vox) et candida et fusca et plena et exilis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 16, § 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic etiam fusca illa vox, qualem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:171" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 171</bibl></cit> (for which <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 38, 141</bibl>, subrauca).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19142" type="main" key="Fuscus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fuscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname;</hi> e. g., </sense><sense id="n19142.1" n="1" level="3"> Aristius Fuscus, <hi rend="ital">an intimate friend of Horace;</hi> v. Aristius.—</sense><sense id="n19142.2" n="2" level="3"> Fuscus, <hi rend="ital">a soldier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courtier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and sensualist of the time of Domitian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:76" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:112" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 112</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19142.3" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fuscī-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Fuscus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
fuse: <entryFree id="n19143" type="main" key="fu_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. fundo, <sense id="n19143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fusilis: <entryFree id="n19144" type="main" key="fu_si^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūsĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fundo</etym>, <sense id="n19144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">molten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liquid</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferventes fusili ex argilla glandes fundis jacere coeperunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of softened clay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43, 1</bibl></cit> (<foreign lang="greek">e)c a)rgi/llhs tethgme/nhs</foreign>, Metaphr.): <cit><quote lang="la">numen (i. e. signum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 4, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa aenea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, 193</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19144.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of molten metal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fusio: <entryFree id="n19145" type="main" key="fu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pouring out</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n19145.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 48</bibl></cit>, Serm. 16, § <cit><quote lang="la">11: tenuis stellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 7</bibl></cit>: Chrysippus ipsum mundum deum dicit esse et ejus animi fusio nem universam, <hi rend="ital">an outpouring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effusion</hi>, <cb n="FUST" /> * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19145.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n19145.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A melting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">casting</hi> of metals: si quis numum falsa fusione formaverit, Cod. Th. 9, 21, 3.—</sense><sense id="n19145.4" n="B" level="2"> (I. q. illatio publica.) <hi rend="ital">A duty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:27:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 27, § 3</bibl> (al. functiones); Cod. Th. 11, 28, 6.</sense></entryFree>
fusius: <entryFree id="n19146" type="main" key="Fu_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fūsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Furius.</entryFree>
fusor: <entryFree id="n19147" type="main" key="fu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fundo</etym>, <sense id="n19147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a founder</hi> in metals, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ollarius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 630, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19147.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He who pours out</hi> any fluid, Hier, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eccl.</author> 3, 8 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
fusorium: <entryFree id="n19148" type="main" key="fu_so_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūsōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 37, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fusorius: <entryFree id="n19149" type="main" key="fu_so_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">molten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made by founding</hi>: fusorius, <foreign lang="greek">xwneutiko/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">opere fusorio,</quote> <trans><tr>by casting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 32, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fusterna: <entryFree id="n19150" type="main" key="fusterna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fusterna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from fusterina, sc. pars, from fustis</etym>, <sense id="n19150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the upper part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knotty part of a fir - tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 76, § 196</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fustibalator: <entryFree id="n19151" type="main" key="fusti^ba^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fustĭbălātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fustibalus</etym>, <sense id="n19151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who fought with the sling-staff</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 14</bibl>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
fustibalus: <entryFree id="n19152" type="main" key="fusti^ba^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fustĭbălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vox hibr., from fustis and <foreign lang="greek">ba/llw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n19152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sling-staff</hi>, an offensive weapon consisting of a staff with a sling attached, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 14</bibl>; cf. the preced. art.</sense></entryFree>
fusticulus: <entryFree id="n19153" type="main" key="fusti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fustĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>fustis</etym>, <sense id="n19153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small piece of wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little stick</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 180, 25</bibl> (al. funiculos): <cit><quote lang="la">allii,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>stalk</tr>, <tr>stem</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fustigo: <entryFree id="n19154" type="main" key="fusti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fustīgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cudgel to death</hi> (v. the foll. art.), Cod. Th. 9, 29, 2; 9, 34, 1; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">culokopw=, tu/ptw tw=| cu/lw|</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: ‡ fustigatus <foreign lang="greek">baklisqei/s</foreign>, ib.</sense></entryFree>
fustis: <entryFree id="n19155" type="main" key="fustis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fustis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>abl.</case> fusti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 8 al.</bibl>, or fuste, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 134</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:98" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:7:section=1 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 7, § 1 al.</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>through the forms fonstis, fond-tis, from root of -fendo, found in offendo, defendo, etc.; cf.: mani-festus, in-festus, con-festim, festino; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qei/nein</foreign>, to strike, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 255" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 255</bibl>; Corss. Ausspr. 2, 190</etym>, <sense id="n19155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a knobbed stick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cudgel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">staff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">club</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptrum, scipio, ferula, baculum): tamquam si claudus sim, cum fusti est ambulandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=137" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 137</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">severae Matris ad arbitrium recisos Portare fustes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 41</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for threshing out grain: ipsae spicae melius fustibus cuduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 4</bibl></cit>. —Esp. for <hi rend="ital">cudgelling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auferere, non abibis, si ego fustem sumpsero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male mulctati clavis ac fustibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non opus est verbis, sed fustibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:30:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 30, 73</bibl></cit>: si filius meus fustem mihi impingere volet? Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos tu nisi fuste coërces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulae caput fuste dolare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuste aperire caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:98" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 98</bibl></cit>: injuria committitur cum quis fuste percussus erit, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 220</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fustium admonitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 7</bibl></cit>.—And for <hi rend="ital">beating to death</hi>, as a milit. punishment (v. fustuarium): <cit><quote lang="la">sorte ductos fusti necat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 4, 5</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">primipili centurionem ob turpem ex acie fugam fusti percussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:78" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 78 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:S. 4:1:34" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> S. 4, 1, 34</bibl> Oud.; Auct. B. Hisp. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 21, 1</bibl>.—Hence: <cit><quote lang="la">formidine fustis (i. e. to be beaten to death) ad bene dicendum redacti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 154</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
