fustitudinus: <entryFree id="n19156" type="main" key="fusti^tu^di^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fustĭtŭdĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fustistundo</etym>, <sense id="n19156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cudgel-banging</hi>, a word comically formed to indicate the place where slaves were beaten: <cit><quote lang="la">apud fustitudinas ferricrepinas insulas, i. e. ergastula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fustuarium: <entryFree id="n19157" type="main" key="fustu^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fustŭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fustis</etym>, <sense id="n19157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cudgelling to death</hi>, a military punishment for desertion or other capital offences: <cit><quote lang="la">fustuarium meruerunt legiones, quae consules reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6, 14</bibl> Drak.; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 825</bibl>; cf. Dict. of Antiq. p. 464.</sense></entryFree>
fustuarius: <entryFree id="n19158" type="main" key="fustua_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fustuārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to a cudgelling to death</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">supplicium (i. q. fustuarium),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 4, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 8, 33</bibl></cit>. <cb n="FUVI" /></sense></entryFree>
fusura: <entryFree id="n19159" type="main" key="fu_su_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fundo</etym>, <sense id="n19159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a founding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">casting</hi> of metals: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fusus: <entryFree id="n19160" type="main" key="fu_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from fundo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19161" type="hapax" key="fu_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fundo</etym>, <sense id="n19161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pouring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outpouring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fons, unde funditur e terra aqua viva, ut fistula, a qua fusus aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=123" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 123</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19162" type="main" key="fu_sus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spindle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19162.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:78" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 23, 27, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:28" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 2, 5, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 348</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 221</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">229</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 22</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 239; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:31:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 31, 19</bibl>.—An attribute of the Fates, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19162.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in mechanics, <hi rend="ital">a cross-bar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rundle</hi> connecting two wheels near the circumference, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
futare: <entryFree id="n19163" type="gloss" key="futa_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">futāre</orth> <itype>arguere est</itype>, unde et confutare. Sed Cato hoc pro saepius fuisse posuit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=89" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 89</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
futatim: <entryFree id="n19164" type="hapax" key="fu_ta_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūtātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>perh. from fundo; qs. by pouring out, i. e.</etym>, <sense id="n19164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abundantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequently</hi>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
futile: <entryFree id="n19165" type="main" key="fu_ti^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūtĭle</orth>, etc., v. futtĭle, etc.</entryFree>
futio: <entryFree id="n19166" type="gloss" key="fu_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūtio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fundo</etym>, <sense id="n19166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pouring out</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 631</bibl> P., but without an example.</sense></entryFree>
futis: <entryFree id="n19167" type="gloss" key="fu_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūtis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.; cf. futtilis</etym>, <sense id="n19167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watervessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pitcher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas aquarium vocant FUTIM, quod in triclinio allatam aquam infundebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=119" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 119</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
futtile: <entryFree id="n19168" type="main" key="futti^le1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">futtĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. futtilis, I.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19169" type="main" key="futti^le_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">futtĭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. futtilis <sense id="n19169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
futtilis: <entryFree id="n19170" type="main" key="futti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">futtĭlis</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">fūtĭlis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 204" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 204</bibl>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fundo; cf. futis</etym>, <sense id="n19170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that easily pours out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19170.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">futtĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a water-vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broad above and pointed below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used at sacrifices to Vesta and Ceres</hi>, Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 19</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:297" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 297</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 231</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 339</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19170.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">that can not contain</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <trans><tr>that void their excrement through fear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:18:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 18, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glacies,</quote> <trans><tr>brittle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 740</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19170.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">untrustworthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">futile</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: frivolus, vanus, levis): servon fortunas meas me commisisse futtili!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">irrideamus haruspices: vanos, futtiles esse dicamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:19:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 19, 36</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quis non odit sordidos, vanos, leves, futtiles?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locutores (with leves et importuni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">competitores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:8:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 511, 6</bibl> (Trag. v. 349 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">futtiles commenticiaeque sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicit quaedam futtilia et frivola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes ejus, quae futiles et conruptae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:41:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 41, 20</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">alacritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et caducum tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 8, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec futilis ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:797" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 797</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in vain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uselessly</hi> (anteand post-class.). </sense><sense id="n19170.4" n="1" level="3"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">futtĭle</orth>: factum futtile, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 514, 14</bibl> (Trag. v. 350 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">provenisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit> Ritschl.—</sense><sense id="n19170.5" n="2" level="3"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">futtĭlĭter</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">blaterata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futile futtiliter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 514, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
futtilitas: <entryFree id="n19171" type="hapax" key="futti^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">futtĭlĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fūtil-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>futtilis, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n19171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emptiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">futility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec plena sunt futtilitatis summaeque levitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
futtiliter: <entryFree id="n19172" type="main" key="futti^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">futtĭlĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fūtil-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. futtilis, <sense id="n19172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 2.</sense></entryFree>
futuo: <entryFree id="n19173" type="main" key="fu^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭtŭo</orth>, <itype>ui, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>supine stem from root fu-, cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fi=tus, fito/w, futeu/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n19173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to have connection with</hi> a female (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:97:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 97, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:81:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 81, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:87:1" default="NO">3, 87, 1</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">te futuente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:3:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
futurus: <entryFree id="n19174" type="main" key="fu^tu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭtūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. sum.</entryFree>
fututio: <entryFree id="n19175" type="main" key="fu^tu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭtūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>futuo</etym>, <sense id="n19175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">copulation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 32, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:107:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 107, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fututor: <entryFree id="n19176" type="main" key="fu^tu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭtūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a copulator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:91:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 91, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:30:3" default="NO">7, 30, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fututrix: <entryFree id="n19177" type="main" key="fu^tu_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭtūtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that copulates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:22:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:61:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 61, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fututus: <entryFree id="n19178" type="main" key="fu^tu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŭtūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from futuo.</entryFree>
fuvi: <entryFree id="n19179" type="main" key="fu_vi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fūvi</orth>, v. sum <sense id="n19179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi> <pb n="799" /> <cb n="GABA" /> <cb n="G." /></sense></entryFree>
g: <entryFree id="n19180" type="main" key="G"><orth extent="full" lang="la">G</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">g</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen> or (on account of littera) <gen>f.</gen>, had originally no place in the Latin alphabet: both the sharp and the flat guttural mutes, our <sense id="n19180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">k</hi> and <hi rend="ital">g</hi> sounds, being represented by C; hence on the Columna Rostrata LECIONES, MACISTRATOS, EXFOCIONT, (pu)CNANDOD, PVCN(ad), CARTACINIENSIS, for legiones, etc.; hence, too, the archaic form ACETARE for agitare (v. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 23</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>), and the still common abbreviation of the names Gaius and Gneus in C and Cn.—At a later period (acc. to Plut. Qu. Rom. p. 277 D and 278 E, by means of a freedman of Spurius Carvilius Ruga, about the beginning of the second Punic war) a slight graphic alteration was made in the C, which introduced into the Roman orthography the letter G (on the old monuments C); thus we have in the S. C. de Bacchanal.: MAGISTER, MAGISTRATVM, FIGIER, GNOSCIER, AGRO; on the other hand, the orthography GNAIVOD PATRE PROGNATVS on the first Epitaph of the Scipios, which dates before that time, indicates either incorrectness in the copying or a later erection of the monument. When Greek words are written in Latin letters and vice versa, G always corresponds to <foreign lang="greek">*g</foreign>. Its sound was always hard, like Engl. <hi rend="ital">g</hi> in gate, at least until the sixth century A. D.As an <hi rend="ital">initial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">g</hi>, in pure Latin words, enters into consonantal combination only with <hi rend="ital">l</hi> and <hi rend="ital">r;</hi> and therefore in words which, from their etymology, had the combination <hi rend="ital">gn</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">g</hi> was rejected in the classical period, and thus arose the class. forms nascor, natus, nosco, novi, notus, narus, navus, from the original gnascor, gnatus, gnosco, etc. (cf. the English gnaw, gnat, gnarr, etc., where the <hi rend="ital">g</hi> has become silent); whereas in compounds the <hi rend="ital">g</hi> again is often retained: cognatus, cognosco, ignarus, ignavus.—An initial <hi rend="ital">g</hi> is dropped in lac (kindred to GALACT, <foreign lang="greek">ga/la</foreign>), likewise in anser (kindred to Germ. Gans; Sanscr. hansa; Greek <foreign lang="greek">xh/n</foreign>).As a <hi rend="ital">medial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">g</hi> combines with <hi rend="ital">l</hi>, <hi rend="ital">m</hi>, <hi rend="ital">n</hi>, <hi rend="ital">r</hi>, although it is sometimes elided before <hi rend="ital">m</hi> in the course of formation; so in examen for exagmen from agmen; in contamino for contagmino (from con-TAG, tango). Before <hi rend="ital">s</hi> the soft sound of <hi rend="ital">g</hi> passes into the hard sound of <hi rend="ital">c</hi>, and becomes blended with the <hi rend="ital">s</hi> into <hi rend="ital">x</hi> (v. the letter X); though sometimes the <hi rend="ital">g</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">c</hi>) is elided altogether, as in mulsi from mulgeo, indulsi from indulgeo; cf.: sparsus, mersus, tersus, etc. So too before <hi rend="ital">t</hi>, as indultum from indulgeo. The medial <hi rend="ital">g</hi> is often dropped between two vowels, and compensated for by lengthening the preced. vowel: māior from măgior, pulēium from pulēgium, āio from ăgio (root AG, Sanscr. ah, to say; cf. nego). Likewise the medial <hi rend="ital">g</hi> is dropped in lēvis for legvis, Sanscr. laghn, fava for fagva, fruor for frugvor, flamma for flagma, stimulus for stigmulus, examen for exagmen; jumentum, from root jug-: sumen from sug-; cf.: umor, flamen, etc.As a <hi rend="ital">final</hi>, <hi rend="ital">g</hi> was only paragogic, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 13</bibl>, in the obsolete VESPERVG (for vesperu, analogous with noctu; v. Spald. ad loc.).<hi rend="ital">Etymologically</hi>, <hi rend="ital">g</hi> corresponds to an original Indo - European <hi rend="ital">g</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gh</hi>, or is weakened from <hi rend="ital">c</hi>, <hi rend="ital">k.</hi> Thus it stands where in Greek we have: </sense><sense id="n19180.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>, as ago, <foreign lang="greek">a)/gw</foreign>; ager, <foreign lang="greek">a)gro/s</foreign>; argentum, <foreign lang="greek">a)/rguros</foreign>; genus, <foreign lang="greek">ge/nos</foreign>; fulgeo, <foreign lang="greek">fle/gw</foreign>, and so very commonly; </sense><sense id="n19180.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <foreign lang="greek">x</foreign> (usually before <hi rend="ital">r</hi>, or in the middle of a word): ango, <foreign lang="greek">a)/gxw</foreign>; rigo, <foreign lang="greek">bre/xw</foreign>; gratus, <foreign lang="greek">xai/rw</foreign>, etc.; </sense><sense id="n19180.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <foreign lang="greek">k</foreign>: viginti, <foreign lang="greek">ei)/kosi</foreign>; gubernator, <foreign lang="greek">kubernh/ths</foreign>; gummi, <foreign lang="greek">ko/mmi</foreign>, etc.—By <hi rend="ital">assimilation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">g</hi> was produced from <hi rend="ital">b</hi> and <hi rend="ital">d</hi> in oggero, suggero, aggero, etc., from obgero, sub-gero, ad-gero, etc.As an <hi rend="ital">abbreviation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">G</hi> denotes Galliarum, Gallica, gemina, Germania, genius, etc.; and sometimes Gaius (instead of the usual <hi rend="ital">C</hi>); v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 467</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1660</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4680</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">G.P.R.F. genio populi Romani feliciter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4957</bibl></cit>; v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 76 sqq.; Roby, Lat. Gr. 1, 38 sqq.</sense></entryFree>
gabali: <entryFree id="n19181" type="main" key="Ga^ba^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Găbăli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gaba/leis</foreign> Strab., <sense id="n19181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Aquitanian Gaul</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Gévaudan</hi>,<cb n="GAES" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:64:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 64, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 75, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 109</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19181.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19181.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Găbă-lĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Gabali</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 42, 97, § 240</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19181.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Găbălĭtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <trans><tr>the capital of the Gabali</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 13</bibl></cit>. <hi rend="ital">Its inhabitants</hi> were called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Găbălĭ-tāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gabalium: <entryFree id="n19182" type="main" key="ga^ba^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">găbălĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n19182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an aromatic shrub in Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 21, 45, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gabalus: <entryFree id="n19183" type="foreign" key="ga_ba^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gābălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>an old Germ. word, i. q. the modern Gabel (fork); hence, as an instrument of punishment</etym>, <sense id="n19183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of gallows</hi> (syn.: furca, patibulum, crux). </sense><sense id="n19183.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: in gabalum aliquem suffigere, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 117, 15</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n19183.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">gallows-bird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hang-dog</hi>, Macrin. ap. Capit. Macrin. 11.</sense></entryFree>
gabaon: <entryFree id="n19184" type="main" key="Ga^ba^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Găbăon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gabaw/n</foreign> (Hebrew <foreign />), <sense id="n19184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Judea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gibeon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 9, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 25 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19184.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Găbăō-nītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Gabaon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gabaonite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gibeonite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gabata: <entryFree id="n19185" type="main" key="ga^ba^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">găbăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. from cavus</etym>, <sense id="n19185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of dish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">platter</hi> (post-Aug.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:48:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 48, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:31:18" default="NO">11, 31, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gabba: <entryFree id="n19186" type="main" key="Gabba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gabba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, in full Apicius Gabba, <sense id="n19186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous wit of the time of Tiberius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:41:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 41, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gabii: <entryFree id="n19187" type="main" key="Ga^bi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Găbĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. gambhas, mouth; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gamfh/</foreign>, jaw; cf. Saxon camb; Engl. <hi rend="ital">comb</hi></etym>, <sense id="n19187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient city of Latium founded by the Sicilians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twelve miles from Rome and eleven from Prœneste</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Castiglione</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 773</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19187.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19187.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Găbīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Gabii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gabine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=33" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 33</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 8</bibl>: via, <hi rend="ital">leading from Rome to Gabii</hi> (called also Praenestina via), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Gabii</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:709" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 709</bibl></cit>: saxum, <hi rend="ital">quarried at Gabii</hi>, of superior quality, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinctus, v. 2. cinctus: vicinitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno,</quote> <trans><tr>worshipped at Gabii</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 682</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Găbīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Gabii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gabines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19187.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Găbĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Gabii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gabine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 94, 96, § 209</bibl></cit> (Jan. Gaviensis).</sense></entryFree>
gabinius: <entryFree id="n19188" type="main" key="Ga^bi_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Găbīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n19188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; so, in partic., </sense><sense id="n19188.1" n="1" level="3"> A. Gabinius, <hi rend="ital">consul with L. Calpurnius Piso</hi> A.U.C. 696; <hi rend="ital">proconsul in Syria; in the service of Cœsar in the Civil War</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:25 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 25 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:18 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 18 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:7:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 7, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19188.2" n="2" level="3"> P. Gabinius, <hi rend="ital">prœtor</hi> A.U.C. 665, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:20:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 20, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19188.3" n="3" level="3"> P. Gabinius Capito, <hi rend="ital">a conspirator with Catiline</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:55" default="NO" valid="yes">55</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n19188.4" n="4" level="3"> Q. Gabinius, <hi rend="ital">the proposer of a law respecting voting in the comitia;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>.—</sense><sense id="n19188.5" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19188.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Găbīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Gabinius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gabinian</hi>: lex, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> A. Gabinius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 19, 57 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 3</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of</hi> Q. Gabinius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:16:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 16, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19188.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gă-bīnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: milites, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> A. Gabinius <hi rend="ital">in the Civil War</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:15" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gabinus: <entryFree id="n19189" type="main" key="Ga^bi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Găbīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Gabii, II. A.</entryFree>
gades: <entryFree id="n19190" type="main" key="Ga_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gādes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>the Phœnician gadis means <hi rend="ital">hedge</hi></etym>, <sense id="n19190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous colony of the Phœnicians established on an island of the same name in</hi> Hispania Baetica, the modern <hi rend="ital">Cadiz</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:1" default="NO">3, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 36, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 19, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 1</bibl>. Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gadir</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gaddir</orth> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ta\ *ga/deira</foreign>), Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 648</bibl> and 698 P. (Hist. Fragm, 2, 26 Dietsch), Plin. l. l.—</sense><sense id="n19190.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gādītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Gades</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 227</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">3: portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gādītāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Gades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 17, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gādītānae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">women of Gades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 3</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gādītānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, i. e. L. Cornelius Balbus, <hi rend="ital">of Gades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 7, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gaesati: <entryFree id="n19191" type="hapax" key="gaesa_ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gaesāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gaesum</etym>, <sense id="n19191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Gallic</hi> <cb n="GALA" /> <hi rend="ital">mercenaries armed with the</hi> gaesum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 4, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gaesum: <entryFree id="n19192" type="foreign" key="gaesum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gaesum</orth>, less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">gēsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Celtic</etym>, <sense id="n19192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heavy javelin of the Gauls;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gaiso/s</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">gai=son</foreign> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">dolo, sarissa, sparus, lancea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 36, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 6, 5</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 555, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 662</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hipp. 111" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hipp. 111</bibl>; cf.: gaesum grave jaculum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=99" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 99</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—In poets the weapon of the Africans, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:444" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 444</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the Greeks,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:64" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gaetuli: <entryFree id="n19193" type="main" key="Gaetu_li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gaetūli</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Gētūli</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gaitou=loi</foreign>, <sense id="n19193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of northwestern Africa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">south of the</hi> Mauri <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Numidae, in the modern <hi rend="ital">Morocco</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Gœtulians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:10:4" default="NO">3, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:80:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes">80, 1 al.</bibl>—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gaetūlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Gœtulian</hi>, collect., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 678</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19193.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19193.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gaetūlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Gœtulians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gœtulian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syrtes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 192</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 351</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 10</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">leaena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mapalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:20:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 20, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">pastor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 21, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>taken on the African coast</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 181</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:319" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 319</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 36, 60, § 127</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, also, transf.: Gaetulisve magis fucaret vellus ahenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:177" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thetis, i. e. mare Libycum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19193.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gaetūlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Gœtulians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19193.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gaetūlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Gœtulian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 31, 36, § 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpurissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 6, 26, § 45</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gaetūlĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of</hi> Cn. Cornelius Cossus Lentulus, <hi rend="ital">the conqueror of the Gœtulians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:40" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:26" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gagates: <entryFree id="n19194" type="greek" key="ga^ga_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">găgātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gaga/ths</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">li/qos</foreign>), <sense id="n19194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">black asphaltum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:141 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 34, § 141 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gaipor: <entryFree id="n19195" type="gloss" key="Gaipor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gaïpor</orth> = Gai puer (like Marcipor = Marci puer), Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=257:20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 257, 20</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
gaius: <entryFree id="n19196" type="main" key="Ga_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gāĭus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cāĭus</orth>; <sense id="n19196.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">trisyl.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:22:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 22, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:36:8" default="NO">11, 36, 8</bibl>); <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Gāi (<case>voc.</case> Gāi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:16:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 16, 1</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gāĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for Gavius; from gaudeo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman prœnomen</hi>, usu. written C.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">G</ref></xr>. Gaia was written O, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 28</bibl>; Vel. Long. p. 2218; P. prol. p. 1502.— At marriage festivals it was customary to call the bridegroom and bride Gaius and Gaia, Fest. s. v. Gaia, p. 71; Quint. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19196.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n19196.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An eminent jurist who lived about</hi> A.D. 110-180, author of the Institutionum Commentarii IV., which contain a systematic summary of the Roman law of family relations, of private property, and of actions; and which for generations was a standard educational work on the subject. This work was known, however, to modern scholars only by the fragments preserved in the Pandects, etc., until in 1816 Niebuhr discovered in the Chapter House of Verona a nearly complete MS. of the original work of Gaius, over which works of St. Jerome had been written. Teuffel, Gesch. d. Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> p. 812 sqq.—</sense><sense id="n19196.3" n="B" level="2"> In post-Aug. historians, esp., <hi rend="ital">the emperor Gaius Caligula;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gāiānus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cāiānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Caligula</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expeditiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">as (because lowered in value by him),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Sil. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gala: <entryFree id="n19197" type="main" key="Gala"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gala</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Masinissa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galactites: <entryFree id="n19198" type="greek" key="ga^lacti_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălactītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">gălactītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">galakti/ths</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">galakti=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n19198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of a milk-white color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise unknown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">milk-stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 162</bibl>. —Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">gălaxias</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">galaci/as</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
galaesus: <entryFree id="n19199" type="main" key="Ga^laesus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gălaesus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gălēs-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n19199.0" n="I" level="1"> <foreign lang="greek">*galai=sos</foreign>, Polyb., <hi rend="ital">a river of Magna Grœcia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Tarento</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Galeso</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl> (3, 32), 67; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:63:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 63, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19199.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wealthy Latin farmer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 535</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">575</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galanthis: <entryFree id="n19200" type="main" key="Ga^lanthis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gălanthis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female attendant of Alcmene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changed by Lucina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom she had deceived</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into a weasel</hi> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gale/h</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:306 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 306 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
galatae: <entryFree id="n19201" type="main" key="Ga^la^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gălătae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gala/tai</foreign>, <sense id="n19201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Celtic people who migrated into Phrygia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Galatians</hi>,<pb n="800" /> <cb n="GALB" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 6</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallograeci</orth>, q. v.—In <number>sing.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gălăta</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a Galatian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Mil. p. 38" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Mil. p. 38</bibl> Orell.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n19201.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gălătī^a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*galati/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the country inhabited by the Galatians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Galatia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ejalet Anadoli</hi> and <hi rend="ital">Karaman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 42, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:80" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 9, 11, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:76" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 76</bibl>. —Called also Gallograecia, q. v.—</sense><sense id="n19201.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gă-lătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Galatians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Galatian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habrotonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 21, 92, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubor,</quote> <trans><tr>of Galatian scarlet-berries</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n19201.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gălătĭcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to mingle Jewish and Christian ceremonies after the manner of the Galatians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Psych. 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19201.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek name for the Gauls;</hi> cf. Gallograeci, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galatea: <entryFree id="n19202" type="main" key="Ga^la^te_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gălătēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, =<foreign lang="greek">*gala/teia</foreign>. <sense id="n19202.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A seanymph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 738</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">789</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">839</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 103</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19202.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rustic maiden</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19202.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A female friend of Horace</hi>, to whom C. 3, 27 is addressed.</sense></entryFree>
galatia: <entryFree id="n19203" type="main" key="Ga^la^ti_^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gălătī^a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n19203.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Galatia</hi>, v. Galatae, I. A.—</sense><sense id="n19203.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A castle between Capua and Caudium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galaticor: <entryFree id="n19204" type="main" key="ga^la^ti^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălătĭcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. Galatae, I. C.</entryFree>
galaticus: <entryFree id="n19205" type="main" key="Ga^la^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gălătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Galatae, I. B.</entryFree>
galaxias: <entryFree id="n19206" type="greek" key="ga^laxi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălaxĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">galaci/as</foreign>. <sense id="n19206.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Milk-stone;</hi> = galactites, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 162</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19206.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Milky Way</hi>, called in pure Lat. Via lactea, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 826 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
galba: <entryFree id="n19207" type="foreign" key="galba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gallic, perh. kindr. with the Germ. gelb (yellow) or Kalb (calf)</etym>. <sense id="n19207.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small worm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ash-borer</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the larva of the ash-spinner</hi>, Bombyx aesculi, Linn. acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19207.1" n="II" level="1"> In the Gallic, i. q. praepinguis, <hi rend="ital">fat paunch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">big belly</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19207.2" n="III" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">a prop. name</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Galba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n19207.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Name of a chief of the Suessiones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19207.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A surname in the</hi> gens Sulpicia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl>.—So, Ser. Sulpicius Galba, <hi rend="ital">consul in</hi> 610; v. Sulpicius; and <hi rend="ital">the emperor of the same name</hi>, Suet. Galb.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:222" default="NO">222</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galbanatus: <entryFree id="n19208" type="hapax" key="galba^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galbănātus</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">galbinātus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>galbinus, II.</etym>, <sense id="n19208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">delicately clothed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galbaneus: <entryFree id="n19209" type="main" key="galba^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galbănĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>galbanum</etym>, <sense id="n19209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of galbanum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nidor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 415</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
galbanum: <entryFree id="n19210" type="main" key="galba^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galbănum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">xalba/nh</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n19210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the resinous sap of an umbelliferous plant in Syria</hi> (the Bubon galbanum, Linn.), <hi rend="ital">galbanum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 56, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:21" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 5, 13, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:916" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 916</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:89" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 89</bibl>.—Also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">galbănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 14, 21</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">chalbăne</orth>, answering to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xalba/nh</foreign>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galbeum: <entryFree id="n19211" type="main" key="galbe^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galbĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">galbĕus</orth> (anciently <orth extent="full" lang="la">calbĕus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>‡ galbus</etym>, <sense id="n19211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of armband</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fillet</hi> (worn as an ornament, or for medical purposes): ‡ galbeum ornamenti genus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=96" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 96</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">‡ calbeos armillas dicebant, quibus triumphantes utebantur, et quibus ob virtutes milites donabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 46</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Cato ap. Fest. s. v. ruscum, p. 265, a Müll.: alii (cognomen Galbae inde trahunt), quod in diuturna valetudine galbeo, id est remediis lana involutis assidue uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
galbina: <entryFree id="n19212" type="main" key="galbi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galbĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bird</hi>, perh. the yellow thrush, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:68:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 68, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galbinatus: <entryFree id="n19213" type="main" key="galbi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galbĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. v. galbanatus.</entryFree>
galbineus: <entryFree id="n19214" type="main" key="galbi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galbĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>‡ galbus</etym>, <sense id="n19214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">yellowish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
galbinus: <entryFree id="n19215" type="main" key="galbi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galbĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>either from galbanum or from GALBUS</etym>, <sense id="n19215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greenish-yellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yellowish;</hi> cf. tunica, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:68:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 68, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingillum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 67, 4</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">galbĭna</orth> (sc. vestimenta), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">pale-green garments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 97</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n19215.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:97:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 97, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
galbula: <entryFree id="n19216" type="main" key="galbu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galbŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n19216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dim</hi>, of galbĭna, v. l. for galgulus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 28, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galbulus: <entryFree id="n19217" type="main" key="galbu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galbŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the nut of the cypresstree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19217.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Dim.</hi>, of galbina, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:68" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 68</bibl> tit.</sense></entryFree>
galbus: <entryFree id="n19218" type="gloss" key="galbus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galbus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">xlwro/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox. [the Germ. gelb (<sense id="n19218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">yellow</hi>）]. <cb n="GALE" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19219" type="main" key="galbus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. calvus <sense id="n19219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
galea: <entryFree id="n19220" type="main" key="ga^le^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindred to Sancr. jal, to cover; cf. celare</etym>, <sense id="n19220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a helmet</hi> (usually of leather), <hi rend="ital">head-piece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morion</hi> (cf. cudo; <cit><quote lang="la">the cassis, on the contrary, was made of metal plate: cassis de lamina est, galea de corio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 14</bibl></cit>). </sense><sense id="n19220.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestandust peregre clupeus, galea, sarcina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix uni alterive cassis aut galea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad galeas induendas tempus defuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 21, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:62:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 62, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 63, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 620</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 365</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:17:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 17, 38</bibl></cit> et saep. Furnished with a visor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:636" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 636</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:20" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 20</bibl>.—Freq. and class. also of <hi rend="ital">brazen helmets</hi> (cf. so the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kune/h</foreign>): tinnit hastilibus umbo Aerato sonitu galeae, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 433 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">loricae galeaeque aeneae, caelatae opere Corinthio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44:section=97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seu caput abdiderat cristata casside pennis, in galea formosus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19220.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the crest of the Guinea fowl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galearia: <entryFree id="n19221" type="gloss" key="galearia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galearia</orth> <itype>a galearum similitudine dicta</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=96" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 96</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
galearii: <entryFree id="n19222" type="main" key="ga^le^a_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălĕārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>galea</etym>, <sense id="n19222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of soldiers' servants</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galearis: <entryFree id="n19223" type="hapax" key="ga^le^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălĕāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a helmet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">helmet-</hi>: reticula, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 222, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galeatus: <entryFree id="n19224" type="main" key="ga^le^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălĕātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. galeo.</entryFree>
galena: <entryFree id="n19225" type="main" key="ga^le_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n19225.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Lead-ore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 53, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:95" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 6, 31, § 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19225.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Dross that remains after melting lead</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 16, 47, § 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galeo: <entryFree id="n19226" type="main" key="ga^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>galea</etym>, <sense id="n19226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover with a helmet.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19226.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: milites in campo jubet galeari, Auct. B. Afr. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; Cinna ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 87, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et barbati quidem Jovis, galeatae Minervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galeati et distincti centuriones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:S. 11:1:27" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> S. 11, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">găleātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a helmed warrior</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:169" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 169</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19226.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: galeatus prologus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in which one defends himself</hi>, Hier. praef. S. Script.</sense></entryFree>
galeola: <entryFree id="n19227" type="hapax" key="ga^le^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălĕŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hollow vessel shaped like a helmet</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 547, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galeopsis: <entryFree id="n19228" type="greek" key="ga^le^opsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălĕopsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gali/oyis</foreign>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">galeobdolon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">galion</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">galeo/bdolon</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">ga/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n19228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant of the nettle kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blind-nettle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 57, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galeos: <entryFree id="n19229" type="gloss" key="ga^le^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălĕos</orth>, <itype>l</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">galeo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of shark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dog-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 12, § 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galeotae: <entryFree id="n19230" type="main" key="Ga^le^o_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gălĕōtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*galew=tai</foreign>, <sense id="n19230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of interpreters of prodigies in Sicily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic (Dionysio) interpretes portentorum, qui Galeotae tum in Sicilia nominabantur, responderunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
galeotes: <entryFree id="n19231" type="greek" key="ga^le^o_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălĕōtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">galew/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n19231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of lizard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 28, § 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galeria: <entryFree id="n19232" type="main" key="Ga^le_ria"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gălēria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Galerius.</entryFree>
galericulum: <entryFree id="n19233" type="main" key="ga^le_ri^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălērĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>galerum</etym>, <sense id="n19233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small covering for the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cap</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:50" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 50</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:S. 4:7:29" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> S. 4, 7, 29</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">A kind of peruke</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 12</bibl>; cf. galerum, II. A.</sense></entryFree>
galeritus: <entryFree id="n19234" type="main" key="ga^le_ri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălērītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that wears a hood.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19234.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima galeritus posuit praetoria Lygmon,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a peasant</tr>, <tr>rustic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 29.—</sense><sense id="n19234.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: galerita avis, <hi rend="ital">the crested lark</hi>, Alauda cristata, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 44, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:62" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 7, 20, § 62</bibl>; called also, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">galeritus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. ales), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=76" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 76</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
galerius: <entryFree id="n19235" type="main" key="Ga^le_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gălērĭus</orth> (scanned Gālĕrĭus, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 7, 6), a, <sense id="n19235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. So, </sense><sense id="n19235.1" n="1" level="3"> Galerius Maximianus, <hi rend="ital">who reigned as emperor with Constantius Chlorus from</hi> A. D. 305, <hi rend="ital">and died</hi> 311, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> de Mort. Pers. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19235.2" n="2" level="3"> Galerius Trachalus, <hi rend="ital">a famous orator under Otho</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 60</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Galeria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">wife of the emperor Vitellius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 6</bibl>.—Galeria tribus, <hi rend="ital">one of the</hi> tribās rusticae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galerum: <entryFree id="n19236" type="main" key="ga^le_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălērum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">gălērus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 688</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gălēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, C. Gracch. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 61</bibl> P.) [galea], <sense id="n19236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a helmet-like covering for the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made of undressed skin</hi>, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kune/h</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a cap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bonnet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hat</hi> (cf.: pileus, petasus, apex). </sense><sense id="n19236.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: flamen Dialis solus album habet galerum, Varr. <cb n="GALL" /> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:32" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 32</bibl>; so of <hi rend="ital">a priest's cap</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 288</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Suetonius tria genera pileorum dixit, quibus sacerdotes utuntur, apicem, tutulum, galerum ... galerum pileum ex pelle hostiae caesae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulvosque lupi de pelle galeros Tegmen habent capiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 688</bibl></cit> (galerus est genus pilei, quod Fronto genere neutro dicit hoc galerum, Serv. ad h. l.); so <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 340</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:208" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 208</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:305" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 305</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19236.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19236.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of peruke</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl> Ruhnk.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 120</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19236.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A rose-bud</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 14, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galesus: <entryFree id="n19237" type="main" key="Gale_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Galēsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Galaesus.</entryFree>
