galgulus: <entryFree id="n19238" type="main" key="galgu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galgŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the witwall</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 28, § 94</bibl> Jan. (al. galbula).</sense></entryFree>
galilaea: <entryFree id="n19239" type="main" key="Ga^li_^laea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gălī^laea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*galilai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n19239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the province of Galilee in northern Palestine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 14, 15, § 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19239.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gălī^laeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Galilee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Galilean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gălĭlaea per arva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gălīlaeas repetat Salvator in oras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 3, 195</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Galilaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Galilee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Galileans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galion: <entryFree id="n19240" type="main" key="galion"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galion</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. galeopsis.</entryFree>
galla: <entryFree id="n19241" type="main" key="galla1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n19241.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Oak-apple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gall-nut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 9, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 4, 5, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 225</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 7, 2</bibl>. —In a pun with Galla, <hi rend="ital">a female Gaul;</hi> v. 1. Galli, I.—</sense><sense id="n19241.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inferior kind of wine</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 445, 18</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=96" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 96</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19242" type="main" key="Galla2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Galla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female Gaul;</hi> v. 1. Galli, I.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19243" type="main" key="Galla3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Galla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a priest of Cybele;</hi> v. 3. Gallus, II. A.</sense></entryFree>
gallaeci: <entryFree id="n19244" type="main" key="Gallaeci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallaeci</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Callaeci</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cal-laïci</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kallaikoi/</foreign> Strab., <sense id="n19244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in western</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, now <hi rend="ital">Galicia and part of Portugal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19244.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19244.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallae-cus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallaïcus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Callaïcus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> Gallaeci, (Call-), <hi rend="ital">Gallœcian</hi> (Call-): <cit><quote lang="la">Gallaica gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 67, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Callaicum aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:39:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 39, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallaica gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 163</bibl></cit>: Gallaecus, <hi rend="ital">a surname of A. Brutus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from his victory over the</hi> Gallaeci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19244.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallaecia</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Call-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the</hi> Gallaeci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gallans: <entryFree id="n19245" type="main" key="gallans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gallans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [3. Gallus, II. A., analogous with bacchans from bacchor], <sense id="n19245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">raving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">revelling like a priest of Cybele</hi> (very rare), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 119, 5</bibl>; Poët. in Anth. Lat. Burm. I. p. 34.</sense></entryFree>
galli: <entryFree id="n19246" type="main" key="Galli1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Galli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Gallic nation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Gauls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">both beyond the Rhine and in Upper Italy; afterwards also in Phrygia as</hi> Gallograeci or Galatae.—Of the Gallograeci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:12 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 12 sq.</bibl>—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a Gaul</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delegit Gallum ex his, quos auxilii causa secum habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallus inter Gallos sine ulla suspicione versatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 45, 4</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Galla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a female Gaul</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter quae (sacrificia extraordinaria) Gallus et Galla, Graecus et Graeca in foro boario sub terra vivi demissi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 57, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence the pun with galla, <hi rend="ital">gall-nut</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19246.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19246.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Gauls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">both beyond the Rhine and in Upper Italy;</hi> the more precise name of the former is Gallia ulterior or Transalpina, and of the latter Gallia citerior or Cisalpina, v. h. vv.—Hence, in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliae duae (provinciae) quas hoc tempore uno imperio videmus esse conjunctas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19246.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Gauls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gallic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">muli viliores Gallicis cantheriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 19, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:362" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 109</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 2, 11, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 14, 7: bella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 47, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 14, 1: ostentatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 53, 3</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <trans><tr>a greyhound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 533</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <trans><tr>the north-northeast wind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gallĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Gallic shoe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(redii) cum calceis et toga, nullis nec gallicis, nec lacerna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:30:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 30, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallĭce</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in Gallic</hi>: a Gallo et a Mauro Gallice et Maurice dicimus,<pb n="801" /> <cb n="GALL" />  Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:25:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 25, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 4</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n19246.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Gallic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliae pro Gallicae, Sall. H. lib. IV.: duae Galliae mulieres conventum vitantes, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 492, 30 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n19246.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Gallic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galla credulitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:1:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 4, 15</bibl></cit> Dietsch.—</sense><sense id="n19246.6" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallĭcānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Roman province Gallia</hi> (<hi rend="ital">in Upper Italy</hi>), <hi rend="ital">Gallican</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio atque res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 26</bibl></cit> (al. Gallicus, like ib. § <cit><quote lang="la">6): lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=39" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 39</bibl></cit> Müll.—Also in gen. for <hi rend="ital">Gallic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">catulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 42, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 247</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallĭcāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the Gallicans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:32:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 32, 2</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">sing.: m.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the province Gallia</hi>, prius enim Gallus, dein Gallicanus, extremo Semiplacentinus haberi coeptus est, Cic. Pis. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—* </sense><sense id="n19246.7" n="F" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Gallic</hi>: Roma, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of the city Arelas, in southern Gaul, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> de Clar. Urb. 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n19247" type="main" key="Galli2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Galli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. 3. Gallus, II. A.</entryFree>
gallia: <entryFree id="n19248" type="main" key="Gallia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. Galli, II. A.</entryFree>
galliambus: <entryFree id="n19249" type="main" key="galliambus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">galliambus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>3. Gallus, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n19249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a song of the priests of Cybele</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 513</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:86:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 86, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gallica: <entryFree id="n19250" type="main" key="galli^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gallĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. Galli, II. B.</entryFree>
gallicanus: <entryFree id="n19251" type="main" key="Galli^ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallĭcānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Galli, II. E.</entryFree>
gallicarius: <entryFree id="n19252" type="main" key="galli^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gallĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gallica, 1. Galli, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n19252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of the Gallic shoe</hi>, Hier. praef. ap. Reg. S. Pachom. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 6.</sense></entryFree>
gallice: <entryFree id="n19253" type="main" key="Galli^ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallĭce</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. Galli, II. B. <sense id="n19253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gallicinium: <entryFree id="n19254" type="main" key="galli^ci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gallĭcĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. gallus-cano</etym>, <sense id="n19254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cock-crowing</hi>, used only transf. as a specification of time, for <hi rend="ital">the last watch of the night</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the break of day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">early dawn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctis gallicinio venit quidam juvenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 24</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 62, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gallicrus: <entryFree id="n19255" type="main" key="galli_^crus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gallī^crus</orth>, <itype>ūris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. gallus-crus</etym>, <sense id="n19255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant crow-foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ranunculus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gallicula: <entryFree id="n19256" type="main" key="galli^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gallĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>gallica</etym>, <sense id="n19256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small Gallic shoe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">galosh</hi>, Hier. ap. Reg. S. Pachom. <hi rend="ital">nos.</hi> 101 and 104.</sense></entryFree>
gallicus: <entryFree id="n19257" type="main" key="Galli^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n19257.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Gauls;</hi> v. 1. Galli, II. B.—</sense><sense id="n19257.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of the river Gallus;</hi> v. 3. Gallus, II. B. 1.—</sense><sense id="n19257.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of the priests of Cybele;</hi> v. 3. Gallus, II. B. 2.</sense></entryFree>
gallidraga: <entryFree id="n19258" type="main" key="gallidraga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gallidraga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hairy teasel</hi>, Dipsacus pilosus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 10, 62, § 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gallina: <entryFree id="n19259" type="main" key="galli_na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gallīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. gallus</etym>, <sense id="n19259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19259.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:27 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 27 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 16, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 26, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 18 al.</bibl>—As a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">dic me igitur tuom passerculum, gallinam, coturnicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 76</bibl></cit>.—Comic.: has (litteras) quidem gallina scripsit. <hi rend="ital">these are hen-tracks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 28</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae filius albae,</quote> <trans><tr>child of fortune</tr>, <tr>fortune's favorite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 141</bibl></cit>; v. filius and albus.—</sense><sense id="n19259.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Gallinas,</quote> <trans><tr>a villa of the Cœsars on the Tiber</tr>, <tr>near Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19260" type="main" key="Galli_na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a gladiator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gallinaceus: <entryFree id="n19261" type="main" key="galli_na_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gallīnācĕus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-acius</orth>, Bücheler, Rhein. Mus. 20, 441; Wagner ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 462</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gallina, 1. gallus</etym>, <sense id="n19261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to domestic fowls</hi> or <hi rend="ital">poultry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallus,</quote> <trans><tr>a poultry-cock</tr>, <tr>dunghill-cock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 427, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 26, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 29, 61</bibl>; for which also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gallīnācĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinacei mares salacissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">salacitas,</quote> <trans><tr>of cocks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: ut vel lactis gallinacei sperare possis haustum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">something uncommon</hi>, Plin. H. N. praef. § 23. —</sense><sense id="n19261.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants. </sense><sense id="n19261.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Cunila gallinacea, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">koni/lh</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of savory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 16, 62, § 170</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19261.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Pedes gallinacei, <hi rend="ital">chicken-feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fumitory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 98, § 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gallinarius: <entryFree id="n19262" type="main" key="galli_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gallīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to poultry.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19262.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19262.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scala,</quote> <trans><tr>a poultry-roost</tr>, <tr>hen-roost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <trans><tr>for the poultry to drink out of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:10:6" default="NO">8, 10, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19262.3" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n19262.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gallīnā-rĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who attends to poultry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 26, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 55, 76, § 155</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19262.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gallīnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <cb n="GAMB" /> <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a hen-house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hen-coop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19262.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as an <hi rend="ital">adj. prop.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19262.7" n="A" level="2"> Gallinaria insula, <hi rend="ital">an island in the Tuscan Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Galinara</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Isola d' Albengo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Vit. S. Mart. 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19262.8" n="B" level="2"> Gallinaria silva, <hi rend="ital">a wood in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Cumœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 23</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinaria pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:307" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 307</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gallinula: <entryFree id="n19263" type="main" key="galli_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gallīnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>gallina</etym>, <sense id="n19263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pullet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chicken</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 215</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Progn. Arat. 387</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gallius: <entryFree id="n19264" type="main" key="Galli^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Galli, II. C.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19265" type="main" key="Gallius2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallius</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n19265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n19265.1" n="1" level="3"> M. Gallius, <hi rend="ital">prœtor</hi> A. U. C. 711, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 12, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19265.2" n="2" level="3"> Q. Gallius, <hi rend="ital">accused of</hi> ambitus, <hi rend="ital">and defended by Cicero</hi> A. U. C. 690; see the fragments in Crell. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> IV. 2, p. 454</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gallograeci: <entryFree id="n19266" type="main" key="Gallo^graeci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallŏgraeci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Galli-Graeci</etym>, <sense id="n19266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Gauls who migrated into Phrygia</hi>, called also Galatae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 11, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19266.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallŏgraecĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the</hi> Gallograeci, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> Galatia (v. Galatae, II. A.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 11, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gallohispani: <entryFree id="n19267" type="main" key="Gallo^hispa_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallŏhispāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. Galli-Hispani</etym>, <sense id="n19267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name for the</hi> Celtiberi, <hi rend="ital">formed after the analogy of</hi> Gallograeci, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Iesai. 18, 66, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gallonius: <entryFree id="n19268" type="main" key="Gallo_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n19268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n19268.1" n="1" level="3"> P. Gallonius, <hi rend="ital">a noted epicure</hi>: O Publi, o gurges, Galloni, es homo miser; cenasti in vita numquam bene, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 24</bibl>; Cic. ib. § 25; 2, 28, 90; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 47</bibl>; Schol. Cruq. ad loc. —</sense><sense id="n19268.2" n="2" level="3"> C. Gallonius, <hi rend="ital">an adherent of Pompey in the Civil War</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gallula: <entryFree id="n19269" type="main" key="gallu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gallŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>galla</etym>, <sense id="n19269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little oakapple</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gall-nut</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 49, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gallulasco: <entryFree id="n19270" type="main" key="gallu^lasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gallŭlasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n19270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [1. gallus], of the voice of boys at the time of changing, <hi rend="ital">to begin to sound manly</hi>: puer, cujus vox gallulascit, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 116, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gallulus: <entryFree id="n19271" type="main" key="Gallu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Galli, II. F.</entryFree>
gallus: <entryFree id="n19272" type="main" key="gallus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. to Sanscr. grī, cry; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gh=rus</foreign>, speech; Lat. garrio, garrulus; Engl. call</etym>, <sense id="n19272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dunghill-cock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:9:3" default="NO">3, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:56 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 26, 56 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:233" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:69:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 69, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 25, § 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cantum galli secundi,</quote> <trans><tr>at second cock-crow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:107" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 107</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 14, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">72</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">gallus in sterquilinio suo plurimum potest,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>every man is cock of his own dunghill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apocol. 402" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apocol. 402</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19273" type="main" key="Gallus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gaul;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">adj. Gallic;</hi> v. Galli, I. and II. D.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19274" type="main" key="Gallus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ga/llos</foreign> Strab., <sense id="n19274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tributary of the Sagaris of Phrygia and Bithynia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to the fable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made those who drank it mad</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kadsha Su</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Gökssu</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:364" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 364</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 42, § 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 2, 5, § 9</bibl>; Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 2, 263</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19274.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19274.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Galli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the priests of Cybele</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so called because of their raving</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:361 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 361 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 42, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:261" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 49, 109, § 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:165" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 12, 46, § 165</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=95" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 95</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 121</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a priest of Cybele</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:81" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:74" default="NO">11, 74</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">resupinati cessantia tympana Galli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:176" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 176</bibl></cit>.—And satirically (on account of their emasculated condition), in the <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 12</bibl>, and 34.—</sense><sense id="n19274.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n19274.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the river Gallus</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> i. q. <hi rend="ital">Phrygian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>. 48 (3, 5, 32 M.).—</sense><sense id="n19274.5" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II. A., of or belonging to the priests of Cybele; hence, transf.) <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the priests of Isis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gallic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turma,</quote> <trans><tr>the troop of the priests of Isis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 13, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19275" type="main" key="Gallus4" n="4"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> gens Cornelia, Aquilia, Sulpicia, etc. So in partic. C. Cornelius Gallus, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> Forum Julii, <hi rend="ital">a Roman poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Virgil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 64</bibl>; Asin. Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
galumma: <entryFree id="n19276" type="hapax" key="ga^lumma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gălumma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prob. altered from <foreign lang="greek">ka/lumma</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n19276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cover</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 67</bibl> (calumma, Kopp.).</sense></entryFree>
gamba: <entryFree id="n19277" type="main" key="gamba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gamba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. from <foreign lang="greek">ka/mph</foreign>, a bending</etym>, <sense id="n19277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hoof</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19</bibl>. <cb n="GANN" /></sense></entryFree>
gambosus: <entryFree id="n19278" type="main" key="gambo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gambōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gamba</etym>, <sense id="n19278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a swelling near the hoof</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">animal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gamelio: <entryFree id="n19279" type="greek" key="Ga^me_li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gămēlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gamhliw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n19279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the seventh month of the Attic year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">answering to the last half of our January and the first of February</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mense Gamelione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 101</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gamma: <entryFree id="n19280" type="greek" key="gamma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gamma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ga/mma</foreign>, <sense id="n19280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Greek letter</hi> <foreign lang="greek">*g</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">gamma.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19280.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. de Lit. 12, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19280.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in the agrimensores, <hi rend="ital">the rectangular shape of a field</hi>, Auct. de Limit. p. 278 and 309 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
gammarus: <entryFree id="n19281" type="main" key="gamma^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gammărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. cammarus.</entryFree>
gammatus: <entryFree id="n19282" type="main" key="gamma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gammātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gamma, II.</etym>, a t. t. of the agrimensores, <sense id="n19282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shaped like a gamma</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gamma-shaped</hi>: limes, Auct. de Limit. p. 228; 255; 271 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
ganea: <entryFree id="n19283" type="main" key="ga_ne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gānĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">gānĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for gas-nea, kindr. to Sanscr ghas, to eat, qs. locus edendi</etym>, <sense id="n19283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eating-house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cook-shop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinary;</hi> also in bad repute as the abode of prostitutes. </sense><sense id="n19283.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form ganea: <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper stetimus in illo ganearum tuarum nidore atque fumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido stupri, ganeae ceterique cultus non minor incesserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ganea lustrisque senectutem acturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:49:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 49, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris et ganeae paratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptu ganeaque satiare inexplebiles Vitellii libidines,</quote> <trans><tr>by prodigal feasts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:2:6 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 2, 6 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19283.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form ganeum (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">immersit aliquo sese, credo, in ganeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 5</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 208, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 343</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ganearius: <entryFree id="n19284" type="main" key="ga_ne^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gānĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ganea</etym>, <sense id="n19284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an eating-house.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19284.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triclinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19284.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: Ganearius <foreign lang="greek">a)/swtos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox. (i. q. ganeo).</sense></entryFree>
ganeo: <entryFree id="n19285" type="main" key="ga_ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gānĕo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glutton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debauchee</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">nepos, asotus), gerro, iners, fraus, heluo, ganeo, damnosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis parricida, quis ganeo, quis nepos, quis adulter, etc. ... inveniri potest, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 119, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">egentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:52:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 52, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:58" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ganeum: <entryFree id="n19286" type="main" key="ga_ne^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gānĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. ganea.</entryFree>
gangaba: <entryFree id="n19287" type="foreign" key="gangaba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gangaba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Persian</etym>, <sense id="n19287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a porter</hi> (= bajulus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gangaridae: <entryFree id="n19288" type="main" key="Ganga^ri^dae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gangărĭdae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Garg-</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gaggari/dai</foreign>, <sense id="n19288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Indian people near the Ganges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the modern Bengal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 18, 22, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:67" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ganges: <entryFree id="n19289" type="main" key="Ganges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ganges</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ga/gghs</foreign>, <sense id="n19289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the river Ganges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 7, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:60 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 60 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 249</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 21 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n19289.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19289.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gangētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Ganges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">found in the Ganges</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 636</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:612" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 612</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a tiger-hunter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:26:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a phœnix</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">20, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19289.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gangētis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>India</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ganglion: <entryFree id="n19290" type="greek" key="gangli^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ganglĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ga/gglion</foreign>, <sense id="n19290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of swelling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">excrescence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gangraena: <entryFree id="n19291" type="greek" key="gangraena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gangraena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ga/ggraina</foreign>, <sense id="n19291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cancerous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eating ulcer on the body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gangrene.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19291.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 34</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 117, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 25</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n19291.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: mali gangraena, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 117, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gannator: <entryFree id="n19292" type="gloss" key="gannator"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gannator</orth> <foreign lang="greek">xleuasth/s</foreign>, Gloss. Graec. Lat.</entryFree>
gannatura: <entryFree id="n19293" type="main" key="ganna^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gannătūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">gannĭtūra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a snarling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yelping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aldh.</author> Laud. Virgin. 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">56 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
gannio: <entryFree id="n19294" type="main" key="ganni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gannĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n19294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to yelp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bark.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19294.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gannire cum sit proprie canum, Varro asinos rudere, canes gannire, pullos pipare dixit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 450, 11</bibl></cit>: nictit canis in odorandis ferarum vestigiis leviter ganniens, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. nictit, p. 177 Müll.; cf. also ‡ gannitio.—Of foxes, Auct. Carm. Phil. 59; Hier. Vit. Hilar. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n19294.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons. </sense><sense id="n19294.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To snarl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grumble</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): gannit odiosus omni totae familiae, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=103" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 103</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ille gannit? quid vult?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:83:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 83, 4</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 450, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:64" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19294.4" n="B" level="2"> In <pb n="802" /> <cb n="GARG" /> gen., <hi rend="ital">to talk loud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gabble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chatter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic nobis gannientibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gannitio: <entryFree id="n19295" type="gloss" key="ganni_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gannītĭo</orth>, <itype>canum querula murmuratio</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=99" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 99</bibl> Müll.; cf. also s. v. nictit, p. 177 ib.</entryFree>
gannitus: <entryFree id="n19296" type="main" key="ganni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gannītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gannio</etym>, <sense id="n19296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a yelping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">barking of dogs.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19296.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1070" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1070</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19296.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19296.3" n="A" level="2"> Of sparrows, <hi rend="ital">a chirping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twittering</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 175</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19296.4" n="B" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">a snarling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grumbling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gannitibus lacessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:60:21" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 60, 21</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a chattering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tattling</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 185</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a whining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moaning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis Nerēidis morientis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 5, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ganta: <entryFree id="n19297" type="foreign" key="ganta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ganta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>old Germ.; the mod. Gans</etym>, <sense id="n19297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(anseres) e Germania laudatissimi. Candidi ibi, verum minores, gantae vocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 22, 27, § 54</bibl></cit>; Ven. Carm. 7, 4, 6: ganta <foreign lang="greek">xhnalw/phz</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
ganymedes: <entryFree id="n19298" type="main" key="Ga^ny^me_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gănymēdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n19298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> i, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:33:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 33, 71</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also in a Latinized form Catamitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex Fest. s. h. v. p. 44, and s. v. alcedo, p. 7 Müll.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ganumh/dhs</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n19298.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ganymede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a son of Laomedon</hi> (acc. to the cyclic poets, whom Cicero follows; acc. to Homer, a son of Tros; acc. to Hyginus, of Assaracus or of Erichthonius), <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of his youthful beauty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was carried off by Jupiter's eagle from Mount Ida to heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and there made Jupiter's cup-bearer in place of Hebe;</hi> as a constellation, <hi rend="ital">the Waterman</hi> (Aquarius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 33, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 40, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 271" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 271</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:29" default="NO">29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:155 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 155 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19298.2" n="B" level="2"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gănymē-dēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ganymede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ganymedean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:17:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 17, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">manu mixta pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:39:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chorus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of beautiful servants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:50:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 50, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19298.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A eunuch in the service of Arsinoë</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an enemy of Cœsar</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 4, 1.</sense></entryFree>
garamantes: <entryFree id="n19299" type="main" key="Ga^ra^mantes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gărămantes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gara/mantes</foreign>, <sense id="n19299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a powerful tribe of the interior of Africa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond the Gœtulians</hi>, in the modern <hi rend="ital">Fezzan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:8:7" default="NO">1, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:36 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 36 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 794</bibl>.— In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gărămas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:705" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 705</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1106" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1106</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19299.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19299.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gărămantĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Garamantes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Garamantian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also i. q. <hi rend="ital">African</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:142" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:440" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 440</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carbunculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 92</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n19299.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gără-mantĭci</orth> = Garamantes, Schol. Vet. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:150" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 150</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19299.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gărămantĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sort of precious stone</hi>, also called sandaresus or sandastros, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 28, § 100</bibl> (al. Garamantites).—</sense><sense id="n19299.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gărămantis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = Garamanticus: <cit><quote lang="la">Nympha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:498" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:679" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 679</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
garganus: <entryFree id="n19300" type="main" key="Garga_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gargānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain ridge in Apulia on which storms are frequent</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monte Gargano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:111 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 111 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:380 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 380 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19300.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gargānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Garganus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gargan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cacumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:34" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gargaphie: <entryFree id="n19301" type="main" key="Garga^phi^e"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gargăphĭe</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Gargăphia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gargafi/h</foreign>, <sense id="n19301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a valley of Bœvtia sacred to Diana</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a fountain of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Actœon was torn to pieces by his hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gargara: <entryFree id="n19302" type="main" key="Garga^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gargăra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ga/rgara, ta/</foreign>, <sense id="n19302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the upper part of Mount Ida</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Troas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a city of the same name at its foot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:549" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 549</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 20</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19302.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gargărĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Gargara</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 25, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gargaridio: <entryFree id="n19303" type="main" key="gargaridio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gargaridio</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. gargarizo <sense id="n19303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gargarisma: <entryFree id="n19304" type="greek" key="garga^risma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gargărisma</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-ismum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:7:99" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 7, 99</bibl>), <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">garga/risma</foreign>, <sense id="n19304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gargle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:8:116" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 8, 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gargarismatium: <entryFree id="n19305" type="hapax" key="garga^risma^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gargărismătĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gargarisma/tion</foreign>, <sense id="n19305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gargle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gargarizatio: <entryFree id="n19306" type="main" key="garga^ri_za_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gargărīzātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gargarizo</etym>, <sense id="n19306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gargling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 57, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:157" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 8, 80, § 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 4, 11, § 31</bibl></cit>. <cb n="GARR" /></sense></entryFree>
gargarizatus: <entryFree id="n19307" type="main" key="garga^ri_za_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gargărīzātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gargarizo</etym>, <sense id="n19307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gargling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 51, § 189</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 53" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gargarizo: <entryFree id="n19308" type="greek" key="garga^ri_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gargărīzo</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">gargaridio</orth>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 117, 7</bibl>; v. the letters D and Z: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gargarisso</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=96" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 96</bibl> Müll.; M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 6</bibl> Mai.), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n19308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">gargari/zw</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to gargle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take a gargle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use as a gargle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19308.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gargarizare iis, quae salivam movent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>; 6, 10; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: ex aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:29" default="NO" valid="yes">29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 34, § 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:188" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 17, 73, § 188</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:236" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 22, 87, § 236</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n19308.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: poëmata ejus gargaridians, dices: O Fortuna, o Fors Fortuna! Varr. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
gargettius: <entryFree id="n19309" type="main" key="Gargetti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gargettĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gargh/ttios</foreign>, <sense id="n19309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the philosopher Epicurus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born in Gargettus</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*garghtto/s</foreign>, a district in Attica), <hi rend="ital">the Gargettian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:94" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gargilius: <entryFree id="n19310" type="main" key="Gargi^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gargĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n19310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n19310.1" n="1" level="3"> Gargilius, <hi rend="ital">a famous hunter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19310.2" n="2" level="3"> Gargilius Martialis, <hi rend="ital">a Roman author of the third century of our era.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n19310.3" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gargĭlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Gargilius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gargilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:41:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 41, § 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
garites: <entryFree id="n19311" type="main" key="Gari_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Garītes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Aquitanian Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bordering on the</hi> Ausci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 27</bibl> dub. (Schneid. prefers Gates).</sense></entryFree>
garoceli: <entryFree id="n19312" type="main" key="Garoce^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Garocĕli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Graioceli.</entryFree>
garon: <entryFree id="n19313" type="main" key="ga^ro^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gărŏn</orth>, v. garum.</entryFree>
garrio: <entryFree id="n19314" type="main" key="garri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">garrĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. gir, speech; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gh=rus</foreign>, voice; Germ. girren, to coo; Engl. call; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 177" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 177</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n19314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to chatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talk</hi> (cf. blatero). </sense><sense id="n19314.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum coram sumus et garrimus quicquid in buccam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiebam etiam nunc plura garrire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 5, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidlibet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aniles fabellas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in aurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:61:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 61, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">garriet quoi neque pes umquam neque caput conpareat,</quote> <trans><tr>will chatter nonsense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 81</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">garris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">garri modo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeculis multis ante gymnasia inventa sunt, quam in his philosophi garrire coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 5, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta est impunitas garriendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19314.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of frogs: <cit><quote lang="la">meliusque ranae garriunt Ravennates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 8</bibl></cit>. Of the nightingale: <cit><quote lang="la">lusciniae canticum adolescentiae garriunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 258</bibl></cit> (3, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
garritor: <entryFree id="n19315" type="main" key="garri_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">garrītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>garrio</etym>, <sense id="n19315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chatterer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">babbler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prater</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">periculosus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
garritus: <entryFree id="n19316" type="main" key="garri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">garrītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chattering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talk</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
garrulans: <entryFree id="n19317" type="main" key="garru^lans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">garrŭlans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [garrulus], <sense id="n19317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chattering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prating</hi> (late Lat.): ineptias, Fulg. Myth. praef.</sense></entryFree>
garrulitas: <entryFree id="n19318" type="main" key="garru^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">garrŭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chattering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">babbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talkativeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garrulity</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n19318.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quoque in alitibus facundia prisca remansit, Raucaque garrulitas studiumque immane loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem non abducet infixum cogitationibus illa neminem satiatura garrulitas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: (pueri) facie et garrulitate amabiles. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extemporalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentia dona Auctoris pereunt, garrulitate sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:52:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 52, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Rhet. 2:13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Rhet. 2, 13, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19318.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornix inauspicatae garrulitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 12, 14, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
garrulus: <entryFree id="n19319" type="main" key="garru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">garrŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>garrio</etym>, <sense id="n19319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chattering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prattling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">babbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talkative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garrulous.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19319.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class., but not in Cic.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">loquax, verbosus): confidentes garrulique et malevoli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">percontatorem fugito, nam garrulus idem est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Lucilius) Garrulus atque piger scribendi ferre laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">garrulus hunc quando consumet cumque: loquaces, Si sapiat, vitet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hujus infantiae garrulam disciplinam contemneremus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct.
