Her.</author> 2, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella verbosi fori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 12, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora,</quote> <trans><tr>time for chatting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 23, 18.—</sense><sense id="n19319.2" n="II" level="1"> <cb n="GAUD" /> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19319.3" n="A" level="2"> Of animals or inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">ales (i. e. cornix),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 547</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:237" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctua in imbre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 87, § 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus lusciniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivus,</quote> <trans><tr>babbling</tr>, <tr>murmuring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:316" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus vento,</quote> <trans><tr>rustling</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <trans><tr>vocal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plectra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:167" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sistra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulus in orbe (trochi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 169</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19319.4" n="B" level="2"> Of the subjects of talk: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudent ubi Garrula securi narrare pericula nautae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:82" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
garum: <entryFree id="n19320" type="greek" key="ga^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gărum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">găron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ga/ron</foreign>, <sense id="n19320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rich sauce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fish-sauce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garum</hi>, made of small fish, esp. the scomber, of which the Romans were exceedingly fond, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:93 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 43, § 93 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:102" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:27:8" default="NO">7, 27, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
garumna: <entryFree id="n19321" type="main" key="Ga^rumna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gărumna</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Garunna</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Garon-na</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n19321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 483</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">o( *garouna=s</foreign> Strab., <hi rend="ital">a river of Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Garonne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:7" default="NO">7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 105</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8</bibl> (7), 11 al.</sense></entryFree>
garumni: <entryFree id="n19322" type="main" key="Ga^rumni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gărumni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Gaul situated along the Garonne</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">St. Bertrand de Comminge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
garus: <entryFree id="n19323" type="greek" key="ga^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gărus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">găros</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ga/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n19323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish</hi>, otherwise unknown, <hi rend="ital">from which the sauce called</hi> garum <hi rend="ital">was prepared</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 43, § 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
garyophyllon: <entryFree id="n19324" type="greek" key="ga^ry^o^phyllon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">găryŏphyllon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cary-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, =<foreign lang="greek">karuo/fullon</foreign>, <sense id="n19324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of Indian spice;</hi> acc. to Sprengel, the Vitex trifolia, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 7, 15, § 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gassinades: <entryFree id="n19325" type="main" key="gassinades"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gassinades</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (lapis), <sense id="n19325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Median precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gaster: <entryFree id="n19326" type="greek" key="gaster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gaster</orth>, <itype>tĕris, and tri</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gasth/r</foreign>, <sense id="n19326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the belly</hi> (pure Lat. venter). </sense><sense id="n19326.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflatio secundum gastera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19326.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a big-bellied vessel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
gates: <entryFree id="n19327" type="main" key="Gates"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gates</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, v. Garites.</entryFree>
gau: <entryFree id="n19328" type="main" key="gau"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gau</orth>, v. gaudium <sense id="n19328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gaudebundus: <entryFree id="n19329" type="main" key="gaude^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gaudĕbundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. gaudibundus.</entryFree>
gaudens: <entryFree id="n19330" type="main" key="gaudens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gaudens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from gaudeo.</entryFree>
gaudeo: <entryFree id="n19331" type="main" key="gaude^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gaudĕo</orth>, <itype>gāvīsus, 2</itype> (archaic <sense id="n19331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> gavisi, Liv. Andron. and Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 868</bibl> P.), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gai/w</foreign>, rejoice, for <foreign lang="greek">gaviw</foreign>; cf. gavisus; root <foreign lang="greek">gau-; ghqe/w, ga/numai</foreign>, etc.; cf. <foreign lang="greek">a)gauro/s</foreign>, proud, <foreign lang="greek">a)/gh</foreign>, astonishment], <hi rend="ital">to rejoice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be glad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joyful</hi> respecting any thing, <hi rend="ital">to take pleasure in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be pleased with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delight in</hi> (of inward joy, opp. laetari, to show one's self glad, exhibit joy; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudere decet, laetari non decet, quoniam docendi causa a gaudio laetitiam distinguimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 31, 66</bibl></cit>); usually constr. with an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, the <case>abl.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> less freq. with the <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quia</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n19331.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or the simple <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae perfecta esse gaudeo vehementerque laetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 136</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tamen esse natum et nos gaudemus et haec civitas dum erit laetabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvum te advenire gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire tu me gaudes?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos sibi Caesar oblatos gavisus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus aliquid magnum agere gaudet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:5" default="NO">2, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:78" default="NO">9, 2, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudari in bonis gaudent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in domo vires remansuras esse gaudebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:7:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; Sen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterare culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:12:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 12, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">motus doceri gaudet Ionicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 18, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laedere gaudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spargere gaudes argumenta viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:84" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19331.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sane gaudeo, quod te interpellavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaude, quod spectant oculi te mille loquentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod scribis te a Caesare cottidie plus diligi, immortaliter gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis viris quod ais probari quae adhuc fecerimus, valde gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19331.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa liberatione et vacuitate omnis molestiae gaudemus, omne autem id, quo gaudemus, voluptas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">correctione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequitate justitiaque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc scientiae genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda ac populationibus, magis quam otio aut requie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaena gaudens miraculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 21, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equis canibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 162</bibl></cit>: rure, <pb n="803" /> <cb n="GAUD" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictis tabellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmine (with delectari iambis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaude sorte tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 14, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille cubans gaudet mutata sorte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ero gaude,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at your master's return</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 31, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:209" default="NO">209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:379" default="NO">379</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 105.—Prov.: gaudet patientia duris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 403</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19331.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis sit (servus), si eri sint tristes: hilarus sit, si gaudeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudebat, me laudabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudeat an doleat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et irasci nos et gaudere fingimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si est nunc ullus gaudendi locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Bursa, te gaudere certo scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admonebo, ut in sinu gaudeant, gloriose loqui desinant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:21:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 21, 51</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <case>acc.</case> (usually with homogeneous or general objects): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc scio mea solide gavisurum gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: ut suum gaudium gauderemus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam id gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudeo, etsi nil scio quod gaudeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc aliud est, quod gaudeamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod gaudere posset, hoc fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 607</bibl></cit>: nunc furit tam gavisos homines suum dolorem, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudent natorum fata parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:231" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu dulces lituos ululataque proelia gaudes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 724</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista pars gaudenda mihi potius quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:29" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 29</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quom gravidam et quom te pulcre plenam aspicio, gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom tu's liber, gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia vos tranquillos video, gaudeo et volupe est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Gaude. <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Quid ego gaudeam? <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Quia ego impero. Age, gaude modo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudes, si cameram percusti forte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea Clotho et Lachesis gaudent, si pascitur inguine venter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:136" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudeles gaudent in tristi funere fratris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in puero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:4:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit> (28): <cit><quote lang="la">tibi gratulor, mihi gaudeo, te amo,</quote> <trans><tr>I for my part</tr>, <tr>as for myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr> the passage <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 145</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19331.5" n="B" level="2"> Like <foreign lang="greek">xai/rein</foreign> of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">to rejoice in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delight in</hi> any thing (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">nec tantum Phoebo gaudet Parnasia rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam oleo gavisa cutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:847" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 847</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umore omnia hortensia gaudent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 39, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rastris atque ablaqueationibus (myrrha),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 15, 33</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">66: addebantur et laudes, quibus haud minus quam praemio gaudent militum animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:60:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 60, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio gaudebit occasione laetius decurrendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(paeon) ante se brevibus gaudet pyrrhichio vel choreo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:16" default="NO">10, 7, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vites) Amineae pingui arvo maxime gaudeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id (sc. consilium, animus) sibi solum per se sapit: id sibi gaudet,</quote> <trans><tr>rejoices for itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19331.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n19331.7" n="A" level="2"> In sinu or in se, <hi rend="ital">to rejoice within one's self</hi> or <hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feel a quiet joy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in sinu gaudeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:21:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 21, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sapit, in tacito gaudeat ille sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:13:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 13, 8</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in tacito cohibe gaudia clausa sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit> (3, 20), 30): <cit><quote lang="la">tam gaudet in se tamque se ipse miratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 22, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19331.8" n="B" level="2"> Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xai/rein</foreign>, as a word of salutation (pure Lat. salvere): <cit><quote lang="la">Celso gaudere et bene rem gerere Albinovano Musa rogata refer,</quote> <trans><tr>take my greetings to Celsus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 15</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">gaudens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">joyful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheerful</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">interea cum Musis nos delectabimus animo aequo, immo vero etiam gaudenti ac libenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl> (4, 13), 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:55" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis Forte coheredum senior male tussiet, huic tu Dic ... gaudentem nummo te addicere,</quote> <trans><tr>with pleasure</tr>, <tr>gladly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 109</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gauden-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rejoicingly</hi> (late Lat. and rare), Pseud. <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 10 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
gaudialis: <entryFree id="n19332" type="main" key="gaudi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gaudĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gaudium</etym>, <sense id="n19332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">glad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joyful</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 128: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 272.</sense></entryFree>
gaudibundus: <entryFree id="n19333" type="hapax" key="gaudi^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gaudĭbundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">gaudebundus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gaudeo</etym>, <sense id="n19333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rejoicing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluti praesenti ac futurae suboli novorum maritorum gaudibundus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
gaudifico: <entryFree id="n19334" type="gloss" key="gaudi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gaudĭfĭco</orth> <foreign lang="greek">xaropoie/w</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
gaudimonium: <entryFree id="n19335" type="main" key="gaudi^mo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gaudĭmōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>gaudeo</etym>, <sense id="n19335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joy</hi> <cb n="GAUL" /> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">jamdudum gaudimonio dissilio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Baruch. 4, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gaudium: <entryFree id="n19336" type="main" key="gaudi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gaudĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> (apoc. form gau, like cael for caelum, do for domum: replet te laetificum gau, Enn. ap. Auson. Technop. 144; Ann. 451 Vahl.), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inward joy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gladness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delight</hi> (opp. laetitia, joy which shows itself externally). </sense><sense id="n19336.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19336.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n19336.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ratione animus movetur placide atque constanter, tum illud gaudium dicitur: cum autem inaniter et effuse animus exsultat, tum illa laetitia gestiens vel nimia dici potest, quam ita definiunt sine ratione animi elationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas dicitur etiam in animo ... non dicitur laetitia nec gaudium in corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Fin. 2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit> (cf. under B.): <cit><quote lang="la">veluti ex servitute erepta (plebs) gaudium atque laetitiam agitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultare laetitia, triumphare gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: meum factum probari abs te triumpho gaudio, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 16</bibl>, A, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">non possum non confiteri, cumulari me maximo gaudio, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudio compleri, gaudio afficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:69 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 69 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuis litteris perlectis exsilui gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tuas litteras legissem, incredibili gaudio sum elatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium, tristitiam ostendimus (manibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missa legatio quae gaudio fungeretur,</quote> <trans><tr>to express their joy</tr>, <tr>offer their congratulations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae gaudio ubi sim nescio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio gaudio paene desipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exclamare gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimare gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ha.</hi> Gaudio ero vobis. <hi rend="ital">Ad.</hi> At edepol nos voluptati tibi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illud gaudii est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—With an <hi rend="ital">object-genitive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium periculosi saltus superati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 55, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19336.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: quocum multa volup ac gaudia clamque palamque, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 247 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum me tantis affecistis gaudiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 105</bibl></cit>; more freq., <hi rend="ital">the outward expressions of joy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminarum praecipue et gaudia insignia erant et luctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 7, 12</bibl></cit> (cf. <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudio exultans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 42, 3</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus gaudiis exsultabis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita varie per omnem exercitum laetitia, maeror, luctus atque gaudia agitabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o qui complexus et gaudia quanta fuerunt!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia prodentem vultum celare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tacito cohibe gaudia clausa sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit> (3, 20), 30 (cf. gaudeo, II. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc scio mea solide gavisurum gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scin' me in quibus sim gaudiis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaudia principium nostri sunt doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:796" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 796</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19336.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">sensual pleasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoyment</hi> (rare; not in Cic.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">above the passage,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; usually in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">dediti corporis gaudiis per luxum et ignaviam aetatem agunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutua gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1205</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:854" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 854</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">communia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1196</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:39" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non umquam reputant quanti sibi gaudia constent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:365" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini atque cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:204" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 41</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi sibique pestiferum hinc abstulit gaudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19336.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, also, like our <hi rend="ital">joy</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">an object which produces joy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cause</hi> or <hi rend="ital">occasion of joy</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ceterum hoc gaudium magna prope clade in Samnio foedatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non animo solum patrio gratum munus, sed corpori quoque salubre gaudium (sc. reditus filii) fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 37, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidus falsis attingere gaudia palmis, i. e. conjugem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugiunt tua gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:20:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 20, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 79, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19336.7" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnes (arbores) florent, et sunt tristes quaedam, quaeque non sentiant gaudia annorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 40, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos est gaudium arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adamas opum gaudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20 praef.</bibl></cit> § 2.</sense></entryFree>
gaudivigens: <entryFree id="n19337" type="gloss" key="gaudi^vi^gens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gaudĭvĭgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gaudiumvigeo</etym>, <sense id="n19337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">alive with joy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of joy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">CHORVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1193</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gaugamela: <entryFree id="n19338" type="main" key="Gauga^me_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gaugămēla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gauga/mhla, ta/</foreign>, <sense id="n19338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a village of Assyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Alexander conquered Darius</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Karmelis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gaulus: <entryFree id="n19339" type="main" key="gaulus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gaulus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. gōlas, a waterpot; cf. also galley, galleon</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">gaulo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pail</hi>, <cb n="GAZA" /> <hi rend="ital">round vessel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19339.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A round merchant vessel</hi>, = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gau=los</foreign> (Hdt. 3, 136 sq.): genus navigii paene rotundum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=96" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 96</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gaunacarius: <entryFree id="n19340" type="gloss" key="gauna^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gaunăcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gaunacum</etym>, <sense id="n19340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dresser of furs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furrier</hi>, Inscr. ap. Don. cl. 8, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 69.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">gaunăcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kauna/kh</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a Persian</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Babylonian fur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepared from weasel</hi>- or <hi rend="ital">mouse-skins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=167" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 167</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gaurelios: <entryFree id="n19341" type="main" key="Gaurelios"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gaurelios</orth>, <sense id="n19341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harbor in the island of Andros</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gaurus: <entryFree id="n19342" type="main" key="Gaurus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gaurus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for its wine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monte Barbaro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 14, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaurus inanis (as producing little),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19342.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gaurā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mount Gaurus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gauran</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Gaurus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:546" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 546</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:28" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from the Lucrine lake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:86" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gausapa: <entryFree id="n19343" type="greek" key="gausa^pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gausăpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">gausăpes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">gausăpe</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (only <number>sing.</number>), and <number>plur.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gausăpa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gausa/phs</foreign>, <sense id="n19343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaggy woollen cloth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frieze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">felt</hi>, used for clothing, covering, etc.; <hi rend="ital">a garment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cover of frieze.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19343.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19343.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nom.</hi>: gausapa, according to Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 80</bibl> P.; and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 759</bibl> P.: gausape, M. Messala ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:152" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 152</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.—Abl.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">involutus coccina gausapa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 28</bibl></cit> (perh. <hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi>): purpureo tersit tunc latas gausape mensas, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 870</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gausape,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: gausape purpureo salutatus, Cass. Sever. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 759</bibl> P.— —</sense><sense id="n19343.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gausapa patris mei memoria coepere, amphimalla nostra, sicut villosa etiam ventralia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 193</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gausapa si sumpsit, gausapa sumpta proba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lutea gausapa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:46" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 46</bibl></cit>: gausapes, lodices purpureas et colloreas meas, Aug. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 80</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n19343.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a shaggy beard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu cum maxillis balanatum gausape pectas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:37" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gausapatus: <entryFree id="n19344" type="main" key="gausa^pa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gausăpātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gausapa</etym>, <sense id="n19344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered with a</hi> gausapa, <hi rend="ital">clothed in frieze.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19344.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitto me in mare, quomodo psychrolutam decet, gausapatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 53:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 53, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19344.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">covered over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apri opera pistoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 38, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gausapina: <entryFree id="n19345" type="main" key="gausa^pi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gausăpĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. gausapinus, II.</entryFree>
gausapinus: <entryFree id="n19346" type="main" key="gausa^pi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gausăpĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gausapa</etym>, <sense id="n19346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of frieze</hi> or <hi rend="ital">felt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19346.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:145" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 145</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n19346.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gau-săpĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. vestis), <hi rend="ital">a frieze coat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:59:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 59, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gausape: <entryFree id="n19347" type="main" key="gausa^pe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gausăpe</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">gausăpes</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">gausă-pum</orth>, v. gausapa.</entryFree>
gavia: <entryFree id="n19348" type="main" key="ga_vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gāvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (=<foreign lang="greek">la/ros</foreign>), <sense id="n19348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bird</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the seamew</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 32, 48, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:204" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 74, 95, § 204</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gavianus: <entryFree id="n19349" type="main" key="Ga_vi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gāvĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Gavius.</entryFree>
gavisus: <entryFree id="n19350" type="main" key="ga_vi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gāvīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from gaudeo.</entryFree>
gavius: <entryFree id="n19351" type="main" key="Ga_vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gāvĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n19351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. So L. Gavius, <hi rend="ital">who was crucified by Verres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:61 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 61 sq.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gāvĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Gavius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n19351.1" n="1" level="3"> †† <orth extent="full" lang="la">gāza</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Persian; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ga/za</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">the treasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the royal treasure</hi>, in Persia. </sense><sense id="n19351.2" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">regia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gaza (sic Persae aerarium vocant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia regia, quam gazam Persae vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:3" default="NO">5, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:5 al" default="NO">5, 6, 5 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n19351.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">treasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">riches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wealth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ab auro gazaque regia manus cohibere possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 23, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa dona ex Hieronis gaza,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 25, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 41, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 41</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 22, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 763</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:562" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 562</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:53:3 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 53, 3 al.</bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam nil nostro in corpore gazae Proficiunt, neque nobilitas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 37</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 504" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 504</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 485 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Med. 485 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
gaza: <entryFree id="n19352" type="main" key="Ga_za" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gāza</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ga/za</foreign>, <sense id="n19352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19352.1" n="I" level="1"> The most celebrated is the ancient city of <hi rend="ital">Gaza</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Palestine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 13, 14, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:144" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 28, 32, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:4" default="NO">4, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:2 al" default="NO">4, 7, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19352.2" n="B" level="2"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gāzētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Gaza</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 17, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19352.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A</hi> <pb n="804" /> <cb n="GELI" /> <hi rend="ital">city of Media</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 16, § 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19352.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Africa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Arabian Gulf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gebenna: <entryFree id="n19353" type="main" key="Ge^benna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕbenna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕbenna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕven-na</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chain of mountains in Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Cevennes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 16, 31, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 25</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕbennae</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 435</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19353.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕbennĭcus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕb-</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕv-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Cevennes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gedrosi: <entryFree id="n19354" type="main" key="Gedro_si"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gedrōsi</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cedrōsi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gedrwsoi\</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*gadrwsoi/</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*gadrw/sioi</foreign>, <sense id="n19354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Asia</hi>, in the modern <hi rend="ital">Mekran</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 78</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gedrōsii</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cedr-</orth>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 3</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gedrūsi</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:94 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 25, § 94 sq.</bibl>— <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gedrōsĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cedr-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Gedrosi</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">*gedrwsi/a</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*kedrwsi/a</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 36, § 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gedusanusager: <entryFree id="n19355" type="main" key="Gedusa_nus ager"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gedusānus ager</orth>, <sense id="n19355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a region in Asia otherwise unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 19, 50</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
gehenna: <entryFree id="n19356" type="greek" key="ge^henna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕhenna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ge/enna</foreign> (Hebrew, Ge-Hinnom, Ge-Ben-Hinnom), a valley near Jerusalem where children were offered to Moloch; <sense id="n19356.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">hence, transf.,</quote> <trans><tr>hell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:22 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 5, 22 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 9 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 6, 111</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 112</bibl>; Aus. Ephem. ap. Orat. 56 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n19356.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕhen-nālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">hellish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of hell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Amic. 22, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24</bibl></cit>, § 4.</sense></entryFree>
geidunni: <entryFree id="n19357" type="main" key="Geidunni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Geidunni</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Geidumni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people subject to the</hi> Nervii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gela: <entryFree id="n19358" type="main" key="Ge^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ge/la</foreign>, <sense id="n19358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city on the southern coast of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at first called</hi> Lindos, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards</hi> Gela, <hi rend="ital">from the River Gela</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Gelas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on which it stood</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Terranova</hi> (acc. to others <hi rend="ital">Alicata</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 7, 41, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 702</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:218" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 218</bibl>. —<orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the river Gela</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Fiume di Terranova</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:470" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 470</bibl>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gelas</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 89</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19358.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv.: </sense><sense id="n19358.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕ-lōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gelw=|os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Gela</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 701</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19358.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕlenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Gela</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43, § 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 33, § 73</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19358.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, the same, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gelasco: <entryFree id="n19359" type="main" key="ge^lasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n19359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [gelo], <hi rend="ital">to turn to ice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to freeze</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini natura non gelascit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 21, 27, § 132</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gelasianus: <entryFree id="n19360" type="main" key="ge^la_si^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlāsĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">gelasi=nos</foreign>, a laugher; from <foreign lang="greek">gela/w</foreign>, to laugh</etym>, <sense id="n19360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a buffoon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jester</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 301</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gelasinus: <entryFree id="n19361" type="greek" key="ge^la^si_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlăsīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gelasi=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n19361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dimple in the cheek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produced by smiling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:25:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 25, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gelatio: <entryFree id="n19362" type="main" key="ge^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gelo</etym>, <sense id="n19362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a freezing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frost</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 233</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 179" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 179</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gelatus: <entryFree id="n19363" type="main" key="ge^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a frost</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gelduba: <entryFree id="n19364" type="main" key="Geldu^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Geldŭba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a castle in</hi> Gallia Belgica, <hi rend="ital">on the Rhine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Gelb</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Gellep</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 28, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
gelefactus: <entryFree id="n19365" type="main" key="ge^le^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gelum+fio</etym>, <sense id="n19365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turned to ice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frozen</hi>, Ven. Fort. Carm. 8, 6, 213.</sense></entryFree>
gelenses: <entryFree id="n19366" type="main" key="Ge^lenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕlenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, v. Gela, II. B.</entryFree>
gelicidium: <entryFree id="n19367" type="main" key="ge^li^ci^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlĭcĭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>gelu-cado</etym>, <sense id="n19367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">frost</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">krumo/s</foreign> (mostly in <hi rend="ital">plur</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">si gelicidia erunt, cum oleam coges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 65, 2</bibl></cit>; so <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:7" default="NO">3, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3" default="NO">11, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturna,</quote> <trans><tr>night-frosts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.— In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:55:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 55, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gelide: <entryFree id="n19368" type="main" key="ge^li^de"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlĭde</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. gelidus <sense id="n19368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gelidus: <entryFree id="n19369" type="main" key="ge^li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (archaic <sense id="n19369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. fem. sing.</hi> gelidaï <cit><quote lang="la">aquaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 693</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gelu</etym>, <hi rend="ital">icy cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">icy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frosty</hi> (a higher degree than frigidus; cf. also: algidus, rigidus, glacialis). </sense><sense id="n19369.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Fibrenus) statim praecipitat in Lirem ... eumque multo gelidiorem facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum est hieme frigidum et gelidum,</quote> <trans><tr>cold and frosty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 693</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam gelidam bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidissimae aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 6, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontium gelidae perennitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 431</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:515" default="NO" valid="yes">515</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 263</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca gelida propinquitate Tauri montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Algidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: Scythes, id. <cb n="GELU" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 5, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:892" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 892</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae frigoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 641</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 287</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 169</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">December,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foci,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>never kindled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus (i. e. Boreas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 711</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19369.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. aqua), <hi rend="ital">water cold as ice</hi> (like frigida; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">calida or calda, warm water): foribusque repulsum Perfundit gelida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 91</bibl></cit>: calidae gelidaeque minister; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19369.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">icy cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stiff</hi> with death, old age, or fright (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, like frigidus): <cit><quote lang="la">(Niobe) corporibus gelidis incumbit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:247" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 247</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 249: vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidus tardante senecta Sanguis hebet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et gelidum subito frigore pectus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:98" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 98</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pavidus gelidusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 688</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:423" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 423</bibl>.—Hence also transf., of death, fright, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidi vestigia leti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 82</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">formido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gĕlĭde</orth> (like frigide, I.), <hi rend="ital">coldly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faintly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indolently</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">yuxrw=s</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod res omnes timide gelideque ministrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 171</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gellius: <entryFree id="n19370" type="main" key="Gelli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gellĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n19370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens; <cit><quote lang="la">so the historians, Gelii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:26:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 26, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Gellius,</quote> <trans><tr>a friend of Cicero</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 33</bibl>; and esp.: Aulus Gellius (on account of the abbreviation A. Gellius, formerly falsely called Agellius), <hi rend="ital">a grammarian of the first half of the second century of the Christian era</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of the</hi> Noctes Atticae: vir elegantissimi eloquii et multae ac facundae scientiae (Gellius), Aug. Civ. Dei, 9, 4.—</sense><sense id="n19370.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gellĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a slave of one Gellius</hi>, Labeo ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 12, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
